Fluency in both Swedish and English is required.


Additional Information

Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?
  • Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
  • Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
  • Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
  • Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
  • End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
  • Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.


"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn

Benefits
  • Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
  • Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
  • A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
  • An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
  • A human-centric and value-based company culture.
  • Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
  • A modern office in central Stockholm.
  • Full provision of work tools.
  • A variety of social events.


Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.

 

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page

Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Senior ML Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!

Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

Title: AI Engineer, Sweden - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Staff Data Scientist - Platform
Description:
As a Staff Data Scientist in Spotify’s Platform Mission, you will play a critical role in driving data-informed decisions for our platform infrastructure. You will develop actionable research, identify improvement opportunities, and influence the evolution of Spotify’s foundational infrastructure. You will primarily (but not exclusively) focus on Spotify’s platforms for data and security. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will ensure that our platforms are efficient, scalable, and aligned with user and organizational needs.

This is an opportunity to work on some of the most complex technical challenges at Spotify, leveraging effective and actionable data science.

What You'll Do


Analyze large datasets to identify bottlenecks and propose actionable solutions to improve platform performance.
Develop recommendations to optimize Spotify’s platform performance, reliability, and scalability.
Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate data science insights into the development of Spotify’s platforms.
Define and measure key performance metrics for platform reliability, scalability, and efficiency.
Partner with leadership to identify high-impact opportunities and prioritize data science projects that drive platform innovation.
Serve as a leader and trusted advisor for data science applications in platform development.
Communicate complex technical findings to diverse stakeholders, including executives and non-technical teams.
Provide technical mentorship to data scientists and analysts within the team.
Advocate for best practices in data science, including reproducibility, and ethical AI considerations.
Explore cutting-edge technologies and methodologies to enhance Spotify’s platform capabilities.
Stay informed on trends in data science, distributed systems, and cloud computing to influence the company’s long-term platform strategy.


Who You Are


Master’s or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a similar field.
8+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or applied statistics, with a focus on large-scale systems or infrastructure.
Proficiency in relevant tools such as Python, R, or BigQuery, and experience with distributed computing.
Comfort with machine learning frameworks and statistical modeling techniques.
Outstanding problem-solving skills with the ability to tackle ambiguous technical challenges.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with an emphasis on storytelling with data. Leadership and collaboration skills, with a proven ability to influence cross-functional teams.
Preferred qualifications: deep understanding of platform infrastructure (including distributed systems, cloud platforms, and SRE principles), proven track record of deploying data science solutions in production environments at scale, experience working with time-series data, anomaly detection, and forecasting in operational systems, familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).


Where You'll Be


This role is based in Stockholm or London.
We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home. We ask that you come in 3 times per week.


Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.

At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.
Show more

Title: AI Expert
Description:
At Sogeti, we believe the best is inside every one of us. Whether you are early in your career or at the top of your game, we’ll encourage you to fulfill your potential to be better. Through our shared passion for technology, our entrepreneurial culture , and our focus on continuous learning, we’ll provide everything you need to do your best work and become the best you can be.  

AI Expert

Är du redo att forma framtiden genom att omvandla information till värde?

Sogeti strävar efter att hjälpa våra kunder genom både strategiska och operativa förbättringar. Vi tror på att utmana befintliga lösningar för att göra dem effektivare och att använda de senaste teknologierna för att skapa värde genom moderna tillämpningar som GenAI.

Din roll:

Sogeti söker AI-experter som vill vara med och driva området i Stockholm i samarbete med kollegor i övriga landet och världen. Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, tekniskt skicklig och driven att förbättra och effektivisera verksamheter. Vi vill att du ska vara en lagspelare som är bra på att arbeta i team men även på att leverera på egen hand. Du är utåtriktad och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste teknologierna. Att hjälpa kunder att identifiera användningsfall och skapa största möjliga värde är något du brinner för.

I denna roll kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i:


Tillämpa stora språkmodeller (LLM) på specifika affärsproblem för att extrahera, bearbeta, klassificera och härleda insikter från ostrukturerade datamängder.
Utveckla domän- eller uppgiftsspecifika språkmodeller för affärsproblem när befintliga modeller inte kan användas.
Utvärdera prestandan för maskininlärningsmodeller och ge rekommendationer för förbättringar.
Hålla dig uppdaterad kring kärnteknologier inom NLP och generativ AI.
Arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och ta gemensamt ägarskap och ansvar för planering, arbete, kvalitet och leverans.
Agera mentor till juniora teammedlemmar för att bidra till en miljö där de får utvecklas genom stöd och support.


Din profil:


Akademisk examen inom Data Science, Data, Machine Learning, Theoretical Linguistics eller motsvarande.
Praktisk erfarenhet av stora språkmodeller (GPT, XLNet, T5, etc.).
God erfarenhet av att använda moderna NLP-verktyg och bibliotek som spaCy, Hugging Face Transformers.
Goda kunskaper i Python-utveckling inklusive bibliotek som NumPy, SciPy och erfarenhet av SQL.
Duktig på att kommunicera och lära ut, förmåga att förklara tekniska koncept för icke-tekniska intressenter.
Flytande i svenska och engelska, både skriftligt och muntligt.
Praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta med både on-prem och molnplattformar, MS Azure är meriterande.
Kunskap och erfarenhet av vektordatabaser som Pinecone, Milvus eller Weaviate är meriterande.


Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:


Innovativ miljö: Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
Karriärutveckling: Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
Flexibelt arbete: Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
Teamkänsla: Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.


Ansökan:

Vi välkomnar varmt din ansökan idag, urvalet sker löpande! Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Team Manager, Johan Alsén på mejl: johan@alsen@sogeti.se

Part of the Capgemini Group, Sogeti makes business value through technology for organizations that need to implement innovation at speed and want a local partner with global scale. With a hands-on culture and close proximity to its clients, Sogeti implements solutions that will help organizations work faster, better, and smarter. By combining its agility and speed of implementation through a DevOps approach, Sogeti delivers innovative solutions in quality engineering, cloud and application development, all driven by AI, data and automation.
Show more

Part of the Capgemini Group, Sogeti makes business value through technology for organizations that need to implement innovation at speed and want a local partner with global scale. With a hands-on culture and close proximity to its clients, Sogeti implements solutions that will help organizations work faster, better, and smarter. Title: Python Developer
Description:
Equal IT is partnered with an exciting FinTech who are building real-time payment systems that actually work!




We are looking for another Senior Engineer to join our team who is comfortable getting deep into the backend, building reliable systems, scaling stuff that’s already working, and helping figure out what comes next.




You Will Spend Your Days

Writing Python — obviously 😄
Building services that talk and process authentication/payment flows
Scaling the platform and improving performance
Owning architecture decisions with the rest of the team
Shipping features that directly impact thousands of users (and counting)




Your Technical Background

3+ years building backend systems (doesn’t have to be all Python, but strong Python helps)
Cloud experience ideally with Google Cloud but AWS or Azure will work
Microservices and service-oriented stuff with a big bonus if done at scale




On top of that.....

Kubernetes, Docker, CI/CD
GO or modern JavaScript Frameworks (frontend knowledge is useful, but not required)
Security best practices around transactions, auth, encryption, etc.
Experience in FinTech, or building systems where things really have to work




Culture

Engineers have a real voice
No micromanagement, just a good team that cares about doing quality work
Growing but not chaotic and small enough that your work has real impact




If this sounds interesting, feel free to message or apply directly and let's go from there.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

Frostbite is EA’s proprietary game engine that comes equipped with tons of tools and technologies designed to build incredible games. Our in-house engine offers the unique ability to adapt to each game while working hand-in-hand to prioritize what to build. Our goal is to empower creators all over the world to bring their best ideas to life by creating an engine that amplifies innovation across every discipline. Learn More: ea.com/frostbite

At Frostbite, we believe that data drives quality, accountability, and innovation in game engine development. We are growing our Frostbite Analytics team in service of this mission, and we want you to join us!

As a Data Scientist on the Frostbite Analytics team, you will report to the Senior Analytics Manager and work side-by-side with the Continuous Development team. Your projects will focus on enhancing developer workflows, increasing build farm efficiency, and improving automated failure triage, allowing engineers to work faster and with greater confidence in their code submissions.

We offer a hybrid working model with three days per week in office.

Responsibilities


Design, implement, and maintain data-driven solutions to improve build-farm operations, CI/CD workflows, and automated test failure analysis.
Analyze telemetry, test results, and other data to identify patterns, inefficiencies, and optimization opportunities.
Integrate actionable analytics into developer tools through dashboards, REST APIs, and automated processes.
Work with data engineers to improve data processing and storage for efficiency, latency, and cost-effectiveness.
Communicate insights and recommendations to leadership and internal partners in business-friendly language


Requirements


2+ years of experience in data science or ML ops, or related analytics roles
Master's in Computer Science, Statistics, or equivalent experience in a related field


Technical Skills


Proficiency in SQL and Python (Scala, C++, or C# is a plus), with experience in real-time analytics and data transformation workflows.
Familiarity with a range of quantitative methods for detecting failures, predicting outcomes, and optimizing processes, such as anomaly/time-series analysis, classification models, and reinforcement learning.
Experience working with telemetry data in software development or similar context
Experience with version control systems like Perforce or Gitlab.
Experience with ML and analytics platforms such as Databricks or SageMaker for developing and deploying models at scale.
Knowledge of CI/CD systems, automated build environments, and developer-facing analytics tools is a plus.


Soft Skills


Curious and analytical: You uncover patterns in data, ask the right questions, and explore new methods to foster continuous improvements that connect to the bigger picture.
Collaborative: You proactively seek out feedback and diverse perspectives, ensuring solutions are well-designed, scalable, and sustainable. You actively listen, adapt, and refine your approach for long-term impact.
Impact-focused: You prioritize high-value solutions that lead to measurable improvements, balancing technical rigor with real-world constraints to enhance efficiency and automation.


About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.
Show more
HTML:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

Frostbite is EA’s proprietary game engine that comes equipped with tons of tools and technologies designed to build incredible games. Our in-house engine offers the unique ability to adapt to each game while working hand-in-hand to prioritize what to build. Our goal is to empower creators all over the world to bring their best ideas to life by creating an engine that amplifies innovation across every discipline. Learn More: ea.com/frostbite

At Frostbite, we believe that data drives quality, accountability, and innovation in game engine development. We are growing our Frostbite Analytics team in service of this mission, and we want you to join us!

As a Data Scientist on the Frostbite Analytics team, you will report to the Senior Analytics Manager and work side-by-side with the Continuous Development team. Your projects will focus on enhancing developer workflows, increasing build farm efficiency, and improving automated failure triage, allowing engineers to work faster and with greater confidence in their code submissions.

We offer a hybrid working model with three days per week in office.

Responsibilities

  • Design, implement, and maintain data-driven solutions to improve build-farm operations, CI/CD workflows, and automated test failure analysis.
  • Analyze telemetry, test results, and other data to identify patterns, inefficiencies, and optimization opportunities.
  • Integrate actionable analytics into developer tools through dashboards, REST APIs, and automated processes.
  • Work with data engineers to improve data processing and storage for efficiency, latency, and cost-effectiveness.
  • Communicate insights and recommendations to leadership and internal partners in business-friendly language

Requirements

  • 2+ years of experience in data science or ML ops, or related analytics roles
  • Master's in Computer Science, Statistics, or equivalent experience in a related field

Technical Skills

  • Proficiency in SQL and Python (Scala, C++, or C# is a plus), with experience in real-time analytics and data transformation workflows.
  • Familiarity with a range of quantitative methods for detecting failures, predicting outcomes, and optimizing processes, such as anomaly/time-series analysis, classification models, and reinforcement learning.
  • Experience working with telemetry data in software development or similar context
  • Experience with version control systems like Perforce or Gitlab.
  • Experience with ML and analytics platforms such as Databricks or SageMaker for developing and deploying models at scale.
  • Knowledge of CI/CD systems, automated build environments, and developer-facing analytics tools is a plus.

Soft Skills

  • Curious and analytical: You uncover patterns in data, ask the right questions, and explore new methods to foster continuous improvements that connect to the bigger picture.
  • Collaborative: You proactively seek out feedback and diverse perspectives, ensuring solutions are well-designed, scalable, and sustainable. You actively listen, adapt, and refine your approach for long-term impact.
  • Impact-focused: You prioritize high-value solutions that lead to measurable improvements, balancing technical rigor with real-world constraints to enhance efficiency and automation.

About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Senior ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.

With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.

Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories


Job Description

Day-to-day life

Design, develop, and deploy cutting-edge machine learning models – crafting bespoke AI solutions for our Nordic clients.
Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, and Google experts to overcome complex challenges and deliver impactful outcomes.
Champion knowledge sharing and mentorship, guiding junior colleagues in the art of machine learning and fostering a culture of continuous learning.
Stay at the forefront of Google Cloud AI/ML technologies, continuously expanding your expertise and exploring new possibilities.
Confidently present solutions to clients, bridging the gap between complex algorithms and real-world business value, while actively cultivating and expanding those customer relationships.



Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube


Qualifications

We're seeking a passionate and experienced ML Engineer with a proven track record in designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models. You'll be a cloud enthusiast with a deep understanding of AI/ML principles and hands-on experience with cloud technologies. As a coding expert, you'll possess strong Python skills and a solid foundation in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain, LangGraph).



Excellent communication is essential – you'll build strong relationships with clients, translate their needs into innovative AI solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. You're a true collaborator, thriving in team environments where knowledge sharing and mutual support are paramount.

Fluency in both Swedish and English is required.


Additional Information

Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?

Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.



"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn

Benefits

Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
A human-centric and value-based company culture.
Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
A modern office in central Stockholm.
Full provision of work tools.
A variety of social events.



Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.

 

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page

Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Senior ML Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!

Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

 

Show more

Title: Open Apply - AI Developer
Description:
What We Offer: - A good working environment that promotes collaboration and innovation - A competitive salary based on your experience and expertise - Paid vacation days to ensure you have a healthy work-life balance - Comprehensive health benefits to support your well-beingFor more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly. Are you passionate about leveraging artificial intelligence to solve complex problems and create innovative solutions? We’re always on the lookout for talented AI Developers to join our team. Whether you’re an experienced professional or just beginning your journey in AI, we welcome open applications from motivated individuals eager to work on cutting-edge projects with the latest technologies - whether you would like to work as a freelancer or consultant. As an AI Developer, you’ll design, develop, and deploy AI-driven solutions that empower organizations to automate processes, enhance decision-making, and deliver superior user experiences. Your role will involve working with large datasets, developing algorithms, and creating machine learning models tailored to solve specific challenges. You’ll collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and domain experts to deliver impactful results. Key responsibilities may include: - Designing and implementing machine learning models and algorithms - Building and deploying AI applications using frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch - Preprocessing and analyzing large datasets for training and testing - Developing natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, or recommendation systems - Collaborating with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver AI solutions - Optimizing AI models for performance, scalability, and accuracy

We’re looking for innovative and analytical minds with a passion for artificial intelligence. While specific requirements may vary by project, ideal candidates will have the following skillset and experience.


A degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related field
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java
Experience with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn
Knowledge of AI domains like NLP, computer vision, or reinforcement learning
Familiarity with big data tools such as Hadoop, Spark, or Databricks
Understanding of cloud platforms (e.g., AWS AI/ML, Azure AI, or Google AI)
Strong mathematical foundation in linear algebra, calculus, probability, and statistics
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively
Good communication skills in English (knowledge of Swedish is a plus)
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med 2-5 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

Rollbeskrivning:

Bakgrund

Sedan maj 2024 så finns en enhet hos kund som sysslar specifikt med s.k. Anläggningsanalys: datadrivet arbete för att besvara förvaltnings- och underhållsfrågor. Enheten jobbar mot flera olika beställare, både inom och utanför kund. Leveranserna som enheten producerar utgörs exempelvis av sammanställd statistik, analysmaterial eller dataverktyg.

För att få den tänkta utvecklingstakten behövs resurser som både kan utföra analyser tillsammans med sakkunniga och öka tillgängligheten för data för verksamheten i stort. Här är enheten Anläggningsanalys och även du som konsult väldigt viktig genom drivandet av diverse utvecklingsprojekt för verksamheten.

Arbetsuppgifter


Arbete med kodning och dataframställning i Power BI DAX och SQL
Att skapa intuitiva och tydliga visualisering i Power BI som besvarar beställarens frågor
Att samla in, tolka och skapa verktyg genom dialog med olika intressenter av data i verksamheten
Att välja lämpliga statistiska eller ML-algoritmer för de byggda modellerna
Kodning i Python kan förekomma i vissa projekt
Kunna redogöra för begränsningar och val som gjorts i de datamodeller som skapas
Att noggrant dokumentera det arbete som gjorts


Arbete sker typiskt sett i små grupper om 2 - 3 personer som driver ett visst utvecklingsprojekt.

Målet för många utvecklingsprojekt är att skapa Power BI rapporter som skickas för produktionssättning i kundens system och därigenom göra det tillgängligt för många intressenter samt beställare samtidigt.

Obligatoriska krav

Utbildning:


Masterexamen från högskola/universitet (120 hp) inom data- och systemvetenskap. Alternativt en masterexamen (120 hp) inom matematik, elkraft eller energi med minst 30 hp inom data och programmering.


Kompetens och erfarenhet:


Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Power BI
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av SQL
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom projekt med dataanalys och datavisualisering
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att planera, leda och samordna framtagning av krav på system eller data för systemutveckling.


Mervärdeskrav


Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet från energibranschen.
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbetsorderhantering, anläggningsförvaltning eller annan relevant erfarenhet av IFS eller UBW eller liknande affärssystem.
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av kodning i Python
Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet med versionshantering


Ansökan Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

Arbetsplats och kultur

Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.

Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Turn complex data into smart, scalable solutions that fuel growth, optimize customer journeys, and deliver real impact for top-tier brands.




What we are looking for:

We are looking for a skilled Data Scientist to join our team and drive real impact for our clients. You’ll work with data from various digital channels, such as online, email, and commerce, to analyze and model information that optimizes customer journeys and boosts digital performance. You’re someone who loves working with complex data, productionalizing systems, and econometric modeling to help brands grow and improve efficiency.




Your background in data science and statistics enables you to spot trends, devise strategies, and directly influence client success. In this role, you’ll design predictive models, develop algorithms, and deliver end-to-end solutions. You stay on top of evolving technologies like AI, always exploring new ways to push your work forward.




You’ll be joining a supportive environment where collaboration is key. While you bring solid experience, we’re committed to your ongoing professional growth in the ever-changing worlds of data science and digital marketing.




What you'll be doing:




Take e-commerce problems into solutions using statistical and ML models
Develop predictive models and machine learning solutions
Present findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
Remain current with the latest data science and digital marketing trends




Qualifications:




Proven experience as a Data Scientist
Familiarity with commerce data
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Hands-on experience deploying and maintaining containerized production-grade ML workloads in production
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) in a deployment context
Fluent in Swedish and English, residing in Sweden




What sets you apart:




Documented experience in marketing mix modeling projects, causal inference, and Bayesian statistics.
Hands-on background in building multi-tenant AI and machine learning systems
Experience with predictive models in commerce.







This is a full-time position with a preferred start date during Q2, based in our office at Birger Jarlsgatan 7, Stockholm.

Show more

You’re someone who loves working with complex data, productionalizing systems, and econometric modeling to help brands grow and improve efficiency.


Your background in data science and statistics enables you to spot trends, devise strategies, and directly influence client success. In this role, you’ll design predictive models, develop algorithms, and deliver end-to-end solutions. You stay on top of evolving technologies like AI, always exploring new ways to push your work forward.


You’ll be joining a supportive environment where collaboration is key. While you bring solid experience, we’re committed to your ongoing professional growth in the ever-changing worlds of data science and digital marketing.


What you'll be doing:


  • Take e-commerce problems into solutions using statistical and ML models
  • Develop predictive models and machine learning solutions
  • Present findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
  • Remain current with the latest data science and digital marketing trends


Qualifications:


  • Proven experience as a Data Scientist
  • Familiarity with commerce data
  • Proficiency in Python, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
  • Hands-on experience deploying and maintaining containerized production-grade ML workloads in production
  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) in a deployment context
  • Fluent in Swedish and English, residing in Sweden


What sets you apart:


  • Documented experience in marketing mix modeling projects, causal inference, and Bayesian statistics.
  • Hands-on background in building multi-tenant AI and machine learning systems
  • Experience with predictive models in commerce.



This is a full-time position with a preferred start date during Q2, based in our office at Birger Jarlsgatan 7, Stockholm.

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
We are looking for a

(Senior) Data Scientist (m/f/d)

(full-time) at our location in Oslo, Berlin, Verl, Stockholm or Amsterdam (flexible working conditions available)

The Data Science (Consumer and Risk) team at Riverty is looking for skilled professionals to build Risk and Fraud machine learning models for our online payment products. Our primary goal is to determine whom to accept and whom to decline based on data from past customers. This involves both detecting fraudulent transactions and identifying trustworthy ones by analyzing payment histories of similar customers.

Your Responsibilities:


Participate in the entire modeling process, from data cleaning and feature engineering to model training and evaluation.
Anticipate potential issues in the model-building process and suggest strategies to mitigate pitfalls.
Engage in coding and code reviews to ensure quality and efficiency.
Collaborate within a cross-functional team to drive innovation and effectiveness.



What You Bring:


Experience working with transactional databases or case handling systems.
A bachelor's, master's, or Ph.D. in a STEM field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or related disciplines).
Ability to work with imperfect data—data collected for purposes other than machine learning.
Hands-on experience deploying models into production.
Proficiency in Python for data science applications.
Familiarity with common data science frameworks in Python.
A strong interest in learning new tools and technologies.



Bonus Skills:


Experience writing production-ready Python code.
Knowledge of SQL, relational databases, Spark, Databricks, VS Code, and Docker.
Previous experience in the risk and fraud domain.



Our Hiring Process:

We aim to make our hiring process smooth and transparent:


Pre-screening Call with HR: A brief conversation to understand your background and motivation.
Live Coding Challenge: A short technical task to evaluate your coding skills.
Interview with the Hiring Manager: A discussion about your experience, problem-solving approach, and team fit.
Bar Raiser Interview with the Department Lead: A final conversation to assess cultural and strategic alignment.



#EUR5

Benefits:


At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer & Data Engineer
Description:
Drivs du av att arbeta med data och utveckla lösningar som gör verklig skillnad? Hos Amendo Tech får du chansen att arbeta i framkant inom machine learning och data engineering för några av Sveriges mest spännande företag. Just nu söker vi drivna och lösningsorienterade specialister för kommande uppdrag inom bank och finans, detaljhandel, myndigheter, produktbolag och snabbväxande startups. Vi erbjuder unika möjligheter för dig som är redo för en ny, stimulerande utmaning.

Din kompetens & profil

Machine Learning Engineer

Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller och som trivs med att analysera stora mängder data för att skapa insikter och affärsvärde.

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:


Programmering: Stark kompetens inom Python, Java eller Scala.
ML-ramverk: Erfarenhet av verktyg som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn eller Keras.
Modellutveckling: Kompetens inom modellträning, optimering och hyperparameter-tuning.
Prediktiv modellering: Erfarenhet av regression, klassificering, klustring och djupinlärning.
Databehandling: Vana vid dataförbehandling och analys, gärna med verktyg som Pandas, NumPy och Dask.
Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av ML-pipelines på AWS SageMaker, Azure ML eller Google Cloud AI.
MLOps: Erfarenhet av CI/CD-principer för ML och verktyg som MLflow, Kubeflow, eller TensorFlow Extended (TFX).
Analytisk förmåga: Förmåga att tolka och kommunicera resultat till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter



Data Engineer

Vi söker även dig som är erfaren inom data engineering och kan bygga skalbara dataplattformar, pipelines och integrationer som möjliggör analys och avancerad datamodellering.

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:


Programmering och scripting: Erfarenhet av Python, Java, Scala, eller SQL.
Dataplattformar och pipelines: Kunskap om verktyg som Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Airflow, eller DBT.
Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av att bygga och hantera dataflöden i molnmiljöer som AWS (Glue, Redshift), Azure (Data Factory, Synapse) eller Google Cloud (BigQuery, Dataflow).
Data Lakes och Data Warehouses: Erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataarkitektur och lagringslösningar för att hantera stora datamängder.
ETL/ELT-processer: Erfarenhet av att utveckla effektiva och robusta ETL/ELT-pipelines.
Big Data-ramverk: Kunskap inom hantering och bearbetning av stora datamängder med exempelvis Hadoop, Hive, eller Snowflake.
Versionshantering och samarbete: God förståelse för versionshantering i Git och vana att arbeta i agila team.
Data Governance och säkerhet: Förståelse för datahanteringsprinciper, GDPR och dataetik.



Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.

Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och för olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.

Om Amendo Tech

Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.

Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!

Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.

Frågor och kontakt

Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization is approaching 150 highly skilled professionals.

Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?

The Role

As an AI Engineer, you will be part of a team that is responsible for our organization's AI-focused initiatives, unlocking the full potential of artificial intelligence to create transformative solutions for our business opportunities. With your expertise in generative AI, you and your team will lead the charge in crafting cutting-edge AI strategies and solutions. You will be pivotal in defining how we apply AI solutions to business problems, mainly through usage of LLMs from various providers. We want to deeply integrate AI across our organization, drive innovation and ensure that AI is a clear part of our business strategy.

You will be reporting to our AI Engineering Manager.

Who You Are

You are an experienced and driven software engineer who has been part of the Generative AI wave, and both experimented with and shipped applications to real users. Complex challenges do not deter you; they intrigue you. You tackle them methodically, finding practical solutions that truly make a difference.

You prefer working in a team with developers, designers and product managers and deeply collaborate with your team rather than working from specifications. You communicate effectively and can discuss the pros and cons of different options in constructive ways.

As the AI field is moving forward at enormous speed, you are constantly following tech news for interesting developments that you can use to solve business problems.

Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, and product managers, to define requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in generative AI, actively following open-source projects and explore innovative AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
Create prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AI solutions to stakeholders.
Document architecture designs, algorithms, and best practices for knowledge sharing within the organization.
Assist and inspire AI development done by other teams in the organization.


Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience in backend development using Python and FastAPI, and React for frontend development. Experience from other languages is also valued as we’re always open to using the best tool for the task at hand.
Proven experience with building applications for real users, spanning design, frontend, backend, databases and infrastructure. We don’t require deep experience in all areas.
You will be asked to demo your experience in the interview process
Proficiency in Swedish


What We Offer


Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools, we sign agreements with the largest players, and we encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work to form a collaborative environment where AI is used throughout the group.
Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.


Location

We find great value in being able to work closely with our Stockholm-based team in person. At the same time, we understand the need to focus deeply without interruptions. Therefore, the team works according to a hybrid setup with 3 days at the Stockholm office, and 2 days remotely from home, combining the best of both worlds.

Excited?

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!

👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo

🔍 About Odevo

🌐 Our Software

Title: Senior AI / ML Engineer
Description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

Jobbeskrivning


Designa, utveckla och produktionssätta skalbara AI/ML-modeller för att möta produktens affärsmål.
Samarbeta med produkt-, ingenjörs- och datateam för att integrera AI-teknologier i produkterna.
Designa och underhålla AI/ML-pipelines och optimerad infrastruktur, med särskilt fokus på Azure.


Din profil (Skall krav)


Flerårig erfarenhet av AI/ML-utveckling och att sätta upp och produktionssätta lösningar i en produktionsmiljö.
Hög kompetens i Python och erfarenhet av att arbeta i molnmiljöer, särskilt Azure.
Gedigen erfarenhet av containerteknologier
Erfarenhet från produktbolag är ett krav.
Förmåga att samarbeta i tvärfunktionella team och arbeta i miljöer med snabba förändringar.
Kompetens inom MLOps, verktyg som Databricks och molnoperationer med Terraform.


Meriterande


Tidigare erfarenhet av co-pilot-projekt, särskilt i mindre och snabbrörliga organisationer.
Erfarenhet från finanssektorn.
Kunskap inom computer vision och arbete med visuellt rika dokument (VRDs).
Erfarenhet av AI-ramverk som PyTorch.
Kompetens inom MLOps, verktyg som Databricks och molnoperationer med Terraform.
Erfarenhet av generativ AI, RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), och utveckling av API-drivna mikrotjänster.


Sista ansökningdatum: 02-05-2025

Om Deploja

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!

🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.

🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.

🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.

💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.

🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?

🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.

🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?


Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.
Show more

Jobbeskrivning

  • Designa, utveckla och produktionssätta skalbara AI/ML-modeller för att möta produktens affärsmål.
  • Samarbeta med produkt-, ingenjörs- och datateam för att integrera AI-teknologier i produkterna.
  • Designa och underhålla AI/ML-pipelines och optimerad infrastruktur, med särskilt fokus på Azure.

Din profil (Skall krav)

  • Flerårig erfarenhet av AI/ML-utveckling och att sätta upp och produktionssätta lösningar i en produktionsmiljö.
  • Hög kompetens i Python och erfarenhet av att arbeta i molnmiljöer, särskilt Azure.
  • Gedigen erfarenhet av containerteknologier
  • Erfarenhet från produktbolag är ett krav.
  • Förmåga att samarbeta i tvärfunktionella team och arbeta i miljöer med snabba förändringar.
  • Kompetens inom MLOps, verktyg som Databricks och molnoperationer med Terraform.

Meriterande

  • Tidigare erfarenhet av co-pilot-projekt, särskilt i mindre och snabbrörliga organisationer.
  • Erfarenhet från finanssektorn.
  • Kunskap inom computer vision och arbete med visuellt rika dokument (VRDs).
  • Erfarenhet av AI-ramverk som PyTorch.
  • Kompetens inom MLOps, verktyg som Databricks och molnoperationer med Terraform.
  • Erfarenhet av generativ AI, RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), och utveckling av API-drivna mikrotjänster.

Sista ansökningdatum: 02-05-2025

Om Deploja

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!

🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.

🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.

🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.

💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.

🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?

🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.

🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

  • Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

Title: AI Engineer
Company: BTR Group🟣 EOR, PEO & Accounting in the Nordics
Description:
What We’re Looking For


3–6 years of experience in machine learning, with hands-on experience in time-series analysis, signal processing, or physiological data (audio, wearables, etc.).
Solid understanding of statistics and the ability to validate and tune models using real-world, often noisy data.
Strong Python skills and experience with NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Experience working with biometric, medical, or audio data is a big plus.
Familiarity with GCP or cloud-based ML workflows (Vertex AI, BigQuery, etc.) is nice to have.
Bonus: Knowledge of sleep science, DSP, or personalization systems.
Strong communication skills — you’ll be working across domains with product and audio experts.


What You’ll Do


Design and implement machine learning models to detect and predict sleep states (REM, NREM, awake) and biometric signals (like breathing rate) from audio or sensor data.
Work with time-series data, including signal preprocessing, noise suppression, and real-time analysis.
Collaborate closely with the CTO (ex-Microsoft ML lead) and a multidisciplinary team to shape the product's intelligence layer.
Translate scientific insights into production-ready pipelines that personalize audio feedback in real time.
Contribute to research and experimentation with adaptive audio response systems.
Help shape a strong engineering culture that balances technical excellence with user empathy.
Show more

  • Help shape a strong engineering culture that balances technical excellence with user empathy.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Python Developer for a Fast-Growing Startup 🚀




Are you a skilled backend developer looking to make a real impact in an ambitious and fast-paced environment?

As part of their team you'll have the opportunity to help shape a product that genuinely improves people’s everyday lives. 🙌




What You’ll Do

🚀 Enhance and expand their platform.
🤝 Collaborate closely with other developers and key stakeholders to identify and address customer needs.
🛠️ Take ownership of projects, driving both development and improvements.




What They're Looking For

🧠 2–3 years of experience in web development, with strong Python skills.
🔍 An analytical mindset and passion for clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
🌐 A solid understanding of digital transformation and industry modernization.
A bonus: Django development, Open API's and integrations, AWS (or other cloud environments)




Why Join Them?

🎉 Be part of an enthusiastic, collaborative team where your contributions matter.
💡 Join a company culture that values creativity, learning, and mutual support.
🏢 Work from a central location with flexibility to suit your lifestyle.
📈 Access career development opportunities in a rapidly scaling startup.







If you’re excited about being a key player in building something transformative and contributing to a growth journey, we’d love to hear from you! ✨ Send us your CV and portfolio today!

Title: Matlab/Python Developer
Description:
🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a Matlab/Python Developer 🚀

Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our

About VIPAS :

Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.

Job Description:

We are looking for an experienced developer to support our client in Gothenburg with system and tool development using Matlab and Python. The role involves working in a complex technical environment, contributing to the development and improvement of systems related to microwave technology.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and maintain analytical tools and systems using Matlab and Python
Work with systems involving microwave technology
Handle and manage technical documentation
Maintain and update relevant technical databases
Collaborate with cross-functional technical teams
Contribute to problem-solving and improvements in complex systems


Requirements:


Strong experience in Matlab and Python development
Documented experience with microwave technology
Strong skills in managing technical documentation and databases
Excellent communication skills in English (both written and spoken)
Relevant educational background in engineering, electronics, computer science, or related field


Location: Gothenburg

Why Join Us?

Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.

You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!

Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at shrini@vipas.se & contact me at +46728479197

Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.

How to Apply:

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!

Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

Title: Researcher within drug development
Description:
The Department of Biochemistry and Biophysics is seeking a Researcher and Head of Unit with experience in drug development for placement at the Biochemical and Cellular Methods Unit, Science for Life Laboratory, Solna.

For more information about the activities at SciLifeLab DDD, please visit www.scilifelab.se/ and www.scilifelab.se/units/ddd-platform/.

More information about us, please visit: the Department of Biochemistry and Biophysics.

Read more

Project description

The Drug Discovery and Development Platform at Science for Life Laboratory (SciLifeLab DDD) is a national infrastructure for academic drug development with the mission to translate academic discoveries into drug candidates for further commercial development. The operation, which has been in place for ten years, has contributed to 15 new spin-off companies, four licensing to “big pharma,” and five candidates in clinical trials. The drug discovery platform has expanded to include over 50 employees at six Swedish universities who jointly support collaborative projects with external academic project owners. The “Biochemical and Cellular Assays” (BCA) unit is affiliated with the Department of Biochemistry and Biophysics at Stockholm University and located at the SciLifeLab campus in Solna. We are now seeking a new Researcher and Head of Unit (HoU) for the BCA unit, which currently consists of five people. The position is permanent and located at SciLifeLab, Karolinska Institutet campus in Solna.

Main responsibilities

As a Researcher and Head of Unit, you will be responsible for the overall planning for the development and use of molecular pharmacology, biochemical, and cellular assays to discover new small molecule and antibody-based prototype drugs. SciLifeLab DDD maintains a semi-industrial environment within the universities where validation of assays, development, and reporting of automated assays with appropriate throughput for the projects are important. Raw data is reported to web-based databases.

You will actively participate in the various programs and in the platform’s management team, as well as in the practical laboratory work within the unit. You will also actively participate, interact, and communicate knowledge regarding the facility’s function, analytical methods, and ensure that results are reported both orally and in writing to the platform’s project groups.

The unit consists, in addition to the HoU, of four employees with extensive scientific and practical experience in drug development within industry, academia, and at SciLifeLab DDD. You will also be responsible for maintaining a creative environment through supportive leadership and effectively managing the administrative tasks assigned to the group within SciLifeLab DDD.

Another important task for you is in collaboration with other units at SciLifeLab DDD, to develop the multidisciplinary activities by introducing and developing new molecular pharmacology methods to identify, for example, multifunctional proximity-inducing molecules with pharmacological properties.

Qualification requirements

Researchers are appointed primarily for purposes of research and must hold a Swedish doctoral degree or an equivalent degree from another country.

Assessment criteria

Requirements


PhD or equivalent in cell, molecular biology, or biochemistry, and previous experience from work in the biotechnology/pharmaceutical industry or a relevant academic research environment.
Previous experience in leadership roles (personnel and/or projects) in an academic or industrial environment with good references.
Proven ability to combine the role of a technical expert with the ability to lead an organization and personnel.
You are a collaborative, pragmatic person with a “can-do” attitude.
It is important that you are highly motivated with the ability to work well in a changing interdisciplinary environment and that you have a clear focus on results and quality.
Great emphasis will be placed on personal competence with proven ability to organize and lead personnel, flexibly manage multiple collaborative projects, and communicate with external stakeholders.
You are motivated to fully engage in research that is formally owned by others.
Practical experience in the development of biochemical methods, cell culture, and cellular assays for compound screening is a requirement.


Advantageous

In the appointment process, special attention will be given to research skills and experience with various plate-based assay methods and operation of robotic liquid handling equipment, as well as automation of assay methods, is highly advantageous. Experience with immunologically based techniques and experience with Excel, electronic lab notebook systems (ELN), database management, and LIMS.

About The Employment

This is a full-time, indefinite-term position with a six-month trial period.

Stockholm University applies individual salary setting. Start date is as soon as possible.

We offer

With us, you will experience the dynamic interaction between higher education and research that makes Stockholm University an exciting and creative environment. You will work in an international environment and get favourable conditions. The university is located in the National City Park with good transport links to the city.

Stockholm University strives to be a workplace free from discrimination and with equal opportunities for all.

Contact

Further information about the position can be obtained from the Director of SciLifeLab DDD, Prof. Per Arvidsson, Per.Arvidsson@scilifelab.se.

Application

Apply for the position at Stockholm University’s recruitment system. Attach a personal letter and CV as well as the attachments requested in the application form. It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure that the application is complete in accordance with the instructions in the job advertisement, and that it is submitted before the deadline.

The instructions for applicants are available at: How to apply for a position.

Stockholm University contributes to the development of sustainable democratic society through knowledge, enlightenment and the pursuit of truth.
Show more

Title: Staff Data Scientist - Platform
Description:
As a Staff Data Scientist in Spotify’s Platform Mission, you will play a critical role in driving data-informed decisions for our platform infrastructure. You will develop actionable research, identify improvement opportunities, and influence the evolution of Spotify’s foundational infrastructure. You will primarily (but not exclusively) focus on Spotify’s platforms for data and security. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will ensure that our platforms are efficient, scalable, and aligned with user and organizational needs.

This is an opportunity to work on some of the most complex technical challenges at Spotify, leveraging effective and actionable data science.

What You'll Do


Analyze large datasets to identify bottlenecks and propose actionable solutions to improve platform performance.
Develop recommendations to optimize Spotify’s platform performance, reliability, and scalability.
Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate data science insights into the development of Spotify’s platforms.
Define and measure key performance metrics for platform reliability, scalability, and efficiency.
Partner with leadership to identify high-impact opportunities and prioritize data science projects that drive platform innovation.
Serve as a leader and trusted advisor for data science applications in platform development.
Communicate complex technical findings to diverse stakeholders, including executives and non-technical teams.
Provide technical mentorship to data scientists and analysts within the team.
Advocate for best practices in data science, including reproducibility, and ethical AI considerations.
Explore cutting-edge technologies and methodologies to enhance Spotify’s platform capabilities.
Stay informed on trends in data science, distributed systems, and cloud computing to influence the company’s long-term platform strategy.


Who You Are


Master’s or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a similar field.
8+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or applied statistics, with a focus on large-scale systems or infrastructure.
Proficiency in relevant tools such as Python, R, or BigQuery, and experience with distributed computing.
Comfort with machine learning frameworks and statistical modeling techniques.
Outstanding problem-solving skills with the ability to tackle ambiguous technical challenges.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with an emphasis on storytelling with data. Leadership and collaboration skills, with a proven ability to influence cross-functional teams.
Preferred qualifications: deep understanding of platform infrastructure (including distributed systems, cloud platforms, and SRE principles), proven track record of deploying data science solutions in production environments at scale, experience working with time-series data, anomaly detection, and forecasting in operational systems, familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).


Where You'll Be


This role is based in Stockholm or London.
We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home. We ask that you come in 3 times per week.


Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.

At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.
Show more
