Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: AI Engineer, Sweden - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Optimization Engineer
Description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.

Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.

In this role, you will be joining the Optimization team, the brain behind our intelligent freight management platform for electric vehicles. Our team focuses on developing cutting-edge optimization algorithms that empower efficient routing, scheduling, and charging strategies for our electric fleet. We are looking for an enthusiastic, humble, and creative Optimization Engineer who is passionate about applying their skills to revolutionize the transportation industry and contribute to a more sustainable future.

What You’ll Do


Use your algorithmic thinking and mathematical skills to develop creative solutions to hard optimization problems related to electric fleet management
Collaborate with software engineers to integrate optimization solutions into our electric fleet management platform
Analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns that can be used to improve optimization models
Engage with stakeholders and other teams to gain insights into the current challenges and opportunities for optimization within our freight management platform



Who You Are


Have experience in algorithm design and optimization
Experience with relevant optimization concepts/techniques (metaheuristics, MIP, CP, …)
Enjoy working in a diverse team environment with close collaboration with other engineers and relevant stakeholders
Are comfortable working with different technologies in a modern tech stack (Java, Go, Python, Microservices, GCP, GRPC, …)
A passion for sustainability and making a positive impact on the environment
Preferred: Familiarity with the transportation and logistics industry



This is a full-time position based in Stockholm or Gothenburg. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible since selection and interviews are held continually.

At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Odense Kommune, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to drive data innovation in the automotive industry, leveraging cutting-edge technologies and big data solutions? Then you might be the Data Scientist we are looking for!




About Us

We are a global company specializing in online car auctions and IT solutions for the automotive industry. With more than 15 years of data across Europe, we are continuously growing and seeking a Data Scientist to help us commercialize our data and create value for our customers.




The Autorola Group is a global leader in online remarketing and automotive IT solutions, as well as business intelligence solutions for used vehicles and professional fleet management.

Headquartered in Denmark, the Autorola Group currently employs around 850 people and has branches in 19 countries across Europe, North America, Latin America, and the Asia-Pacific region.

Through an extensive network of companies, manufacturers, banks, leasing companies, and fleet managers, Autorola offers dealers worldwide the opportunity to acquire and market vehicles through auctions. Our product portfolio is complemented by our workflow management system, which enables the digital integration of individual customer processes throughout the entire vehicle lifecycle, as well as our artificial intelligence, which provides real-time indicators for developments in the used car market.







Your Role

Reporting to the Head of Data Science in our Business Unit, Indicata, you will play a key role in building and maintaining our big data platform, supporting various markets with data insights, Power BI dashboards, and developing data science solutions that enhance our appraisal engine and forecasting capabilities.




Your key responsibilities include:

Developing and maintaining our big data platform, including building out the data lake.
Engaging in platform discussions and collaborating on data architecture.
Utilizing SQL, Python, R, and Power BI for data analysis and dashboard creation.
Working closely with the Data Engineer to prepare datasets for analysis.
Designing and executing complex data analyses across multiple markets.
Commercializing data insights to add value to our customers.
Ensuring data quality and optimizing existing algorithms.
Supporting and potentially developing machine learning solutions over time.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.







Your Profile

We imagine you have at least 2 years of relevant experience, but we are also open to recent graduates with the right motivation and approach. Additionally, we expect you to have:

Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, and Power BI.
Experience with Spark and Databricks is a plus.
Strong commercial acumen and the ability to translate data insights into business value.
Experience in creating Power BI dashboards for complex data analysis and forecasting.
A methodological approach to problem-solving and improving data-driven solutions.
Familiarity with the “Team Data Science Process” or similar to be able to work structured and independently on own projects.
The ability to work both independently and collaboratively with stakeholders.
A willingness to learn about the automotive industry and its data ecosystem.







What We Offer

Autorola A/S is a global company with over 850 employees and 19 subsidiaries across Europe, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific.

You will get the opportunity to work for a fast-growing company that collaborates with some of the strongest brands in the automotive industry. Our environment is characterized by an informal and easygoing communication culture. Our headquarters is located right by the railway station at Skibhusvej 52 A, 5000 Odense C.




You will be included in the pension scheme and health insurance, as well as have the chance to participate in company social events. We offer a good lunch arrangement, a fitness room, and a Friday bar to end the week on a high note.




Want to Join the Team and Have an Impact on the Future?

We are looking to fill the position as soon as possible, so if you see yourself thriving in the above-mentioned tasks, we look forward to receiving your application.




Even if you do not meet all the ideal requirements, we encourage you to apply, as we strongly believe in inclusion and diversity.




We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to remove the advertisement once we find the right candidate.




If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to Christian Gless, Tech Talent Acquisition Partner, by phone at +45 31624481.

Show more

Title: AI Research Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

At Teton, we are redefining the role of healthcare workers through cutting-edge AI technology. Facing a global nursing shortage, our solutions offer vital support to overburdened health systems. We distinguish ourselves by focusing relentlessly on product excellence and user experience, rapidly deploying solutions that make a real difference.

At this stage of our company we require a physical presence in our office in Copenhagen, Denmark. We believe this enables the fastest and most efficient iteration cycles to build an impactful product that users love to use.

The Job

We are looking for a research scientist to help us push the frontiers in our AI’s capabilities. We are looking for a candidate with a strong engineering / research background that is creative and organised. Your code will be deployed to our fleet and therefore being able to create solutions and thoroughly validating them is key to this role.

At Teton You Will Be Working On


Deep learning methods for real-time object detection, pose estimation, depth and segmentation.
Developing tracking and action recognition systems.
Building a scalable training simulator using SOTA within 3D reconstruction (NeRF, 3DGs), procedural generation and diffusion models.
Train deep learning models and deploying them to our fleet
Building data pipelines and software to efficiently handle large amounts of data.


You thrive in an intense, fast-paced environment and are eager to deliver the best technology to healthcare workers and patients. You will probably deploy something new to care workers in a real hospital every week.

You’ll be in close collaboration with the rest of the technical team on a daily basis. This job is in-person in our office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

How is it to work at Teton?

We are a tight, but growing, team of extremely hard working and talented people. The learning curves are steep and expanding one’s skill set is encouraged. It’s a workplace where you get your hands dirty and learn a lot. If you are looking for the vibe of large corporations, this is not the place for you, but if you like to build products and strive to be the best in your field, we believe that Teton is a place where you will thrive.

What We Offer

All full-time employees at Teton are offered to be part of a warrant program (stock options) in the company in addition to your salary. We recently closed our second funding round and are offering sizeable warrant packages.

You get to work with state-of-the-art technology and be a pioneer within your field.

All the amenities that create a great working environment are available in the office.

We are looking for a teammate

We are looking for people who believe in our long-term vision and value ownership and entrepreneurship rather than just another 9-5 job.

With us you will have an opportunity to truly make an impact on the world with the outcomes of your work. So, if you are looking for a ride not just a job – jump on board 😊

Need To Have Experience With


Python, PyTorch (experience with TensoRT is a plus)
Degree in Computer Science, Robotics, Physics, similar field(s) of study, or equivalent practical knowledge
Strong coding skills
Strong knowledge of deep learning: layer details, loss functions, optimization, etc.
Strong skills in computer vision / graphics (experience with 3D vision is a plus)
Ability to rapidly prototype and test new algorithms
Minimum 3 years experience


Nice To Have Experience With


WebSockets, MQTT, etc.
Rust
SQL
CI / CD pipelines
AWS, GCP, etc.
Unity Unreal Engine 5
Show more

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world’s largest airports rely on Veovo.  Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to “go brilliantly”.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they’re big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK, Poland, Denmark, New Zealand and the US, Veovo offers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What We Are Looking For


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What We Offer In Return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ Hækken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data and analytics, and eager to drive business value through actionable insights? Do you thrive in dynamic environments and love turning complex data into clear, impactful solutions?




We’re looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join the team in Copenhagen for a 12 month period. You will play a pivotal role in our Customer Insights initiatives, helping us understand customer behaviors and enhance decision-making across the organization.




Would you like to…




Lead and steer data tracks of projects, conducting exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover trends and insights within large datasets
Develop and maintain AI-driven codebases, including predictive models, classification algorithms, and clustering techniques
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate AI and data science solutions into business operations
Provide BI expertise by creating and maintaining dashboards using tools like PowerBI
Translate complex data findings into clear, concise, and actionable insights for stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Develop and implement data models to support business intelligence and reporting initiatives




We would like you to be…




Highly proficient in SQL and PySpark, with experience in data modeling for business intelligence
Experienced in traditional Machine Learning projects, including predictive modeling, classification, and clustering
Skilled in Python for data analytics, with the ability to implement and optimize models
Hands-on with Databricks or Dremio for large-scale data processing and analysis
Strong in data visualization, particularly with PowerBI or similar dashboarding tools
Familiar with Natural Language Processing (NLP) concepts and their application in customer insights (a plus)




Would you like to join…




A team that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning
An environment where your insights directly impact business decisions and customer satisfaction
A culture that encourages innovation and the sharing of ideas




Please note Designit can only consider applicants with the right to work in Denmark.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to be a part of a dedicated team that works with creating digital services? Are you eager to turn customers’ pains into new solutions which accelerate the sustainable transition of the electricity grid? Do you enjoy discovering new insights from diverse data sources? Are you excited about working on proof-of-concept projects that lead to commercial solutions?

Here Is What The Job Entails

In the position as Data Scientist your primary responsibility will be to conduct data experiments to identify and develop innovative solutions that address customer issues by leveraging the hidden value within data obtained from meters and grid sensors. You will do this through direct and consistent contact with Product Managers, Software Developers, customers, UX Designers, and Hardware Developers.

More specifically, you will be responsible for:


Proof-of-concept projects and collaborating with our software development team who will develop the final commercial solution
Doing data discovery on new and existing data sources
Framing new ideas for data analytics based on dialogue with internal and external stakeholders
Working on PoC projects together with customers
Designing and developing algorithms for customer-facing products



In this role, you will gain a thorough understanding of how utilities operate and how data science is applied within this sector. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to develop your skills within data science while seeing your solutions make a real difference for our customers and their transition to a more sustainable energy future.

Meet your future team

With direct reference to our Head of Product Portfolio Management, you will become part of a team of 6 highly skilled colleagues who work every day to bring smart metering solutions and services to our markets. The team consists of many backgrounds ranging from highly technical profiles to profiles with a commercial and strategic focus and background. This diversity in background helps us achieve a high level of quality and development in our work, which is something we value highly in our department.

Did you know? You will be part of a dedicated cross-functional team within the team focusing on developing and testing and launching new data-based services for our customers.

Less About Us, More About You

We are looking for a talented Data Scientist who can take our analytical platform to new heights in collaboration with partners and customers worldwide. Your curiosity drives you to innovate and create new data solutions that are centered around customer needs.

In order to succeed, we imagine that you:


Have a master’s degree in engineering or natural sciences, which has given you an understanding of concepts used in power systems.
Have experience with programming and data analysis in Python, as well as machine learning techniques
Are proficient in collaborative coding using tools like git
Have a strong drive to translate customers’ needs into commercial solutions
Have excellent collaboration skills, thriving in interactions with both internal stakeholders and customers



As we are an international organization it is important that you are fluent in English. Knowledge of Danish will be seen as an asset.

We want to support a diverse and inclusive workplace, so while you may not meet all the qualifications listed above, you could still be a good candidate for the position. If you find the role intriguing, do not hesitate to apply.

We are more than an ordinary workplace

We cherish the good colleagueship which we all contribute to, the only limit is your engagement. As we are a big organization you are bound to find one or more colleagues who share the same interest as you. This might be in our board game club, on our cycling team, during our yearly summer festival, or on the padel court. For example, our Team lead, Service Delivery is also our volunteer padel instructor while one of our Software Test Engineers run weekly spinning classes.

Besides the best colleagues you could imagine, we also offer:


Work life balance through flexible working hours
Employee benefits including a healthy canteen, fitness facilities, in-house dental clinic, hairdresser, and a free health clinic
An active employee association that fosters a collaborative and supportive workplace community
Beneficial health care and insurance package



Do you want to be a part of Kamstrup?

Please submit your application by using the link below. Applications are reviewed on a continuous basis, and you can expect a response within six weeks.

The job will be located at Kamstrup's headquarters in Stilling, between Aarhus and Skanderborg.

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Head of Product Portfolio Management, Lauge Andreas Kjær on phone: +45 89 93 10 00.

Get to know us

At Kamstrup, you'll become part of a close-knit community that genuinely cares about one another, fostering connections both in and out of the workplace. Our team comprises innovators, dreamers, and doers, united by an unyielding passion to challenge the status quo, find better solutions, and constantly push the boundaries of what's possible all with the purpose of securing clean water and energy to the maximum number of people. With an unwavering commitment to growth, we offer opportunities for you to leverage your skills and drive our business to new heights, empowering you to leave your mark on our future and grow with us.

Explore more on our website, see our annual report, and stay updated through LinkedIn for the latest news and job openings.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning developer with DSP experience (Python/C++)
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have an interest in Signal Processing and Machine Learning? Do you want to develop tracking algorithms used by top athletes and in TV broadcast all around the world?  Then come and join our Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team!

As a member of the team, you will be part of a highly-skilled team focusing on the development and optimization of our state-of-the-art tracking algorithms used to measure ball and equipment kinematics across sports. Our products combine Doppler radars and cameras, and the Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team is responsible for converting raw radar signals into accurate and meaningful data on the performance of the athlete, fusing the radar signal with information from video feeds and other sensors.

You will play a significant role in the development of our world-leading, proprietary golf and baseball sensor technology, which is now also being applied in football and many other sports. You will have the opportunity to do your own research and development work, and to see the direct impact of it.

In the Radar Tracking and Signal Processing team we seek to expand the use of machine learning and you will play a significant role in including neural networks in our tracking software.

Responsibilities:


Design, prototype, and evaluate machine learning models tailored for radar analysis.
Stay abreast of and incorporate the latest research findings and methodologies in machine learning and radar into our solutions.
Build knowledge of machine learning methods in the radar tracking & signal processing team through close collaboration with Vision & AI team.
Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks.
Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments.


Requirements


Master’s degree or Ph.D. in computer science, electrical engineering, or equivalent
Machine learning and neural networks
Digital Signal Processing (DSP)


Other relevant topics include:

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.


Software development and programming skills within C++ and Python
Strong mathematical skills
Optimization algorithms
Statistical signal processing
Software development experience
Strong communication skills


Responsibilities


Design, prototype, and evaluate machine learning models tailored for radar analysis
Stay abreast of and incorporate the latest research findings and methodologies in machine learning and radar into our solutions
Build knowledge of machine learning methods in the radar tracking & signal processing team through close collaboration with Vision & AI team
Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks
Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments


We expect that you can work independently as well as contribute in a fast-paced, innovative environment together with highly skilled colleagues. 

We offer:


Highly skilled colleagues
Career growth inside trackman
International environment with more than 35 nationalities in our HQ
Working with the leading golf technology brand in the industry
Social activities


Are you our new colleague?

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.

In the radar tracking & signal processing team we value teamwork and openness. Therefore, we expect you to enjoy working with other highly motivated colleagues and help provide a good working environment. We do not expect that you can be an expert on every aspect of being a developer, but rather strive to improve and learn together with the team.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology.

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work. Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud of working in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race.

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our new headquarter located in Denmark (Hørsholm) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Poland, Seoul and Tokyo.  We employ more than 800 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where all hardware and most software products are developed, tested, and manufactured.

Where innovation happens

At TrackMan, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody’s voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of the exceptional solution. This mix is what makes TrackMan an inspiring company – for our customers and our colleagues.

Share our Passion!

Applications are continuously assessed, so please send your application including and your diploma as soon as possible to join a company with great technologies, passionate colleagues, and great opportunities to grow. Working place for this position is at Trackman Innovation Center in Hørsholm, our new HQ building. Contact Troels Bastholm at troels@trackman.recruitee.com for further information.

Apply now
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way—but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

As part of the MLOps team, you’ll work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and other stakeholders to bring machine learning models to life—ensuring they’re deployed, maintained, and monitored efficiently in production. You’ll have the opportunity to improve model performance and infrastructure, all while contributing to Trustpilot’s AI-based solutions.

What You’ll Be Doing


Model Deployment: Collaborate with data scientists to take machine learning models from development to production, ensuring quality work and scalability.
Build Pipelines: Develop and maintain data and model pipelines, integrating seamlessly with our existing systems to support reliable, efficient workflows.
CI/CD for ML: Design and implement continuous integration and delivery pipelines to streamline the deployment of machine learning models.
Model Monitoring: Help monitor the performance of machine learning models post-deployment, ensuring reliability, scalability, and quality over time.
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to design solutions that meet business needs while adhering to best practices in machine learning and software engineering.
Optimize: Continuously improve our infrastructure, ensuring we remain at the forefront of AI model production and delivery.


Who You Are


Solid technical foundation in both machine learning and software engineering.
Experience deploying machine learning models in production environments.
Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Familiarity with cloud platforms like GCP, AWS, or Azure.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines for machine learning (e.g., Vertex AI).
Experience with data processing frameworks and tools, particularly Apache Beam/Dataflow is highly desirable.
Knowledge of monitoring and maintaining models in production.
Proficiency in employing containerization tools, including Docker, to streamline the configuration of deployment settings.
Problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot model and pipeline issues.
Good communication skills, enabling effective collaboration across teams.


What’s In It For You


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.


Show more

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Title: Student Data Scientist / Data analyst – Join a Fast-Growing Scale-Up!
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Student Data Scientist – Join a Fast-Growing Scale-Up!

Are you passionate about uncovering business opportunities through data? Do you want to be part of a fast-growing company where your skills will make a real impact? If so, we have the perfect student job for you!

Legal Desk: Innovation, Growth & A Great Place to Work

At Legal Desk, we are transforming the legal industry through automation, making legal services more accessible and affordable for individuals and businesses across the Nordics.

As Denmark’s leading provider of automated legal services, we help form over 30% of all new Limited liability companies in Denmark and are expanding into Sweden and Norway. With 275,000+ users, our growth is accelerating - and we want you to be part of the journey!

At Legal Desk, we believe that innovation, creativity, and ownership fuel success. As a Student Data Scientist, you’ll gain hands-on experience in a dynamic, supportive, and fast-moving environment, all while having the flexibility to balance work with your studies.

If you're ready to apply your skills to real-world challenges and grow in a company that values your development, then let’s talk! 🚀

Shape the Future of Data at Legal Desk

As our Student Data Scientist, you’ll play a key role in transforming our data into powerful insights that drive smarter decision-making. Your work will involve integrating diverse data sources (GA4, Virk open data, internal databases, etc.) into dynamic dashboards, helping uncover key insights, solve business challenges, and improve our platform’s performance.

If you love working with data, thrive in a fast-paced startup environment, and want to make a real impact, we want to hear from you!

What You’ll Do


Identify business challenges and opportunities and translate them into meaningful visualizations.
Analyze data to optimize business operations and improve the customer experience. Build data models and visualizations, primarily for dashboards.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders in marketing and UX to collect, process, and integrate data from multiple sources.


Who You Are


Currently pursuing a Master’s degree in Data Science or a related field
A strategic thinker with a business-oriented mindset
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, startup environment
You live in Sweden or Denmark, and you are able to work from our physical office in Copenhagen. Work from home is optional from time to time, however we find it important that you are a part of the social culture in Legal Desk, why you must be able to work form the physical office.


Your Technical Skills

Must haves:


Python – Very proficient (3+ years, including academic experience)
Strong understanding of Python and database structures
Experience with key Python libraries: Pandas. Plotting libraries (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly)
SQL experienced + basic knowledge of data-base structures


Nice to have


Familiarity with Git (basic experience required)
Basic web scraping knowledge
Basic understanding of HTML & CSS
Basic knowledge of BI dashboard principles
Experience with Google Analytics (GA4) and Looker is a plus, but not required
Experience with Streamlit (Python module) is a plus, but not required


Why Join Us?

At Legal Desk, we offer a flexible work environment that adapts to your studies, allowing you to balance your education with real-world experience. You’ll work alongside a vibrant team of students, gaining hands-on experience in a supportive and innovative environment.

But it’s not just about work - you’ll also get to be part of our thriving social culture! From company trips to some of our many Friday bars, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to connect, collaborate, and have fun with your colleagues.

If you’re excited about using data to drive meaningful change - apply today! 🚀

Write a very brief motivational letter along with your CV.

DEADLINE: Monday 5th May 2025
Show more

Title: Data Scientist, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

As a Data Scientist and Senior Data Scientist, you'll be part of our rapidly growing team. You'll have the chance to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, scrappy, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Talented Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Transforming Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist in Risk Management
Description:
Are you interested in further enhancing your analytical skills while exploring new opportunities in your career? All of this in an informal and social environment?




You will be part of the Risk Management team with 17 motivated individuals with diverse backgrounds in mathematics, statistics, physics, finance, compliance and shipping.




Our responsibility is to identify, measure and monitor market risk, credit risk and liquidity risk. We also manage bunker risk and are responsible for security risk and compliance with sanctions regulations.







The tasks that await you

You will, together with a team of 3 developers, share the responsibility of developing solutions supporting risk management and finance in analysis of market risks and projection of future expected cashflow and earnings.




Solutions are developed internally, and cover several advanced systems:

Voyage analysis system, used for operational performance measurement.
Risk system, used to measure and monitor risks.
Selected systems used by the Finance department, forecasting cashflow, estimated results and more.




The tasks that you can expect will more specifically be:

Migration of on-prem solution to Azure Cloud.
Develop and maintain systems and source code.
Support risk analysts, voyage performance analysts and finance business partners with correct and timely updated systems.
Participate in projects within Risk Management and Finance.







Your core qualifications

To thrive in the position, you resonate with the following statements:

You have a degree in relevant technical, economic, or mathematical study.
You possess a keen interest in programming.
You have experience with Azure Cloud.
You have proficient analytical skills.
You have advanced English communication skills and are eligible to work in Denmark.




Besides this you are interested in acquiring skills within risk and financial forecasting and you can easily transform business requirements into technical implementation.







Application

Please upload your application focusing on your motivation, resume and relevant diplomas via our website as soon as possible and no later than 18 May 2025. We review applications and interview candidates on an ongoing basis.




We appreciate a range of perspectives, educational experiences, and professional skill sets, so we invite all qualified individuals to apply for the role.




The start date is flexible.




We look forward to hearing from you.




Were you missing anything in this job ad? Please share your feedback with us here.







Our company

NORDEN is a global provider of ocean-based freight services for bulk and project cargo of all sizes. We integrate freight solutions with port logistics helping our customers to optimise and decarbonise supply chains. We provide tailored solutions based on flexibility, reliability and intelligence. ​




Our agile business model ensures stability by continuously adapting our fleet ​to market developments and customer needs.




Founded in 1871, NORDEN is one of Denmark’s oldest internationally operating shipping companies. Incorporated in Denmark, we are listed on Nasdaq Copenhagen as a part of the OMX Nordic Large Cap index.




With 19 offices across 6 continents, NORDEN is a truly integrated part of global trade.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Drive meaningful change

At our Data & Analytics department, we specialize in data visualizations, BI tools, analytical consulting, statistics, forecasting, and modern data platforms. Working closely with various departments across Abacus, we combine our analytical expertise with a deep understanding of pharmaceutical markets—from product development to delivery.

We believe that robust Data Science and AI can give Abacus Medicine a competitive edge, uncovering trends and behaviors that drive smarter decision-making. Our advanced machine learning techniques transform complex market data into actionable forecasts. Join us on our growth journey and help shape the future of the pharmaceutical industry.

Get a glimpse of our world

The Data Science team consists of five highly skilled professionals, all dedicated to improving access to medicines by delivering critical data and insights that drive informed decision-making.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams—including data analysts, data engineers, product managers, and key business stakeholders—to develop scalable, data-driven solutions that scale.

Are you ready to embark on this journey with us?

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing and deploying machine learning models that power business insights and operational efficiencies and support tactical and strategic decision-making across Abacus Medicine.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Proactively identify potential data science applications for value creation.
Design, develop, and deploy advanced models, including machine learning, deep learning, and algorithmic solutions, to solve complex business problems.
Analyze datasets to generate actionable insights, ensuring data-driven decision-making.
Design and maintain scalable MLOps pipelines for seamless model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.
Promote best practices in Data Science by optimizing workflows and expanding the DS/ML toolbox with tools that enhance model accuracy, runtime, and maintainability.
Strengthen our technical infrastructure by integrating modern technologies that enhance efficiency, scalability, and long-term maintainability.
Drive innovation by evaluating and integrating emerging ML/AI methodologies, including LLMs, to enhance model performance.
Translate complex model results into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Share expertise through mentoring, knowledge sharing, and sparring sessions.
Helping shape the data science strategy and contributing to the broader Data & Analytics roadmap.


Fuel for your success in the role

We Imagine You Have


Master’s degree in a data science-related field (e.g., computer science, cognitive science, IT, mathematics/statistics, economics).
3+ years of experience in applied data science, with a strong focus on machine learning and predictive modeling.
Advanced Python programming skills.
Expertise in supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques.
Proficient in Data Science skills – ML frameworks (scikit-learn, deep learning frameworks), data wrangling, data analysis, and visualization.
Proficient in the following technologies: MLOps and model deployment, Cloud platform (e.g. Azure/AWS), mlflow, SQL, Spark, ETL processes, CI/CD processes, Linux commands, Web APIs, Git.
Excellent English communication skills with the ability to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Show genuine care for both team dynamics and the success of the organization, fostering a positive and inclusive work culture.


Preferred Qualifications


Databricks environment for building, deploying and managing ML models.
Leveraging LLMs for enhancing the performance of ML models through prompt engineering and embedding extraction


Interested?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV and cover letter.

If you have any further questions about the role, please do not hesitate to contact the hiring manager,

Mihai Popovici, Advanced Analytics, Data Science & Tech Lead at mihai.popovici@abacusmedicine.com

Would you like to know more about us?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.

Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,300 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Kindly note that the position will remain open until we have identified the right candidates, at which point the job advertisement will be taken down. Therefore, we encourage interested applicants to submit their applications as soon as possible

Title: AI/ML Engineering Manager
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way—but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

Engineering Manager

Calling All Transformative Engineering Managers!

Are you a natural leader with a passion for empowering teams and driving operational excellence in AI and machine learning? Whether you come from a ML/AI engineering, data engineering or software engineering background, Trustpilot is looking for a driven Engineering Manager to lead our AI Platform team!

The Mission Awaits

As an Engineering Manager at Trustpilot, you’ll lead a team focused on building and maintaining the infrastructure, tools, and processes that enable scalable, reliable, and efficient AI and ML operations. Your leadership will be key in defining and evolving best practices for deploying, monitoring, and managing AI and ML models in production. Your technical expertise and leadership will shape the future of AI and ML operations at Trustpilot.

Your Role As An Engineering Manager


Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of engineers, fostering a collaborative and high-performance environment.
Drive the team’s technical vision, ensuring alignment with business goals and best practices in AI and ML operations.
Own the delivery process, ensuring initiatives are implemented on time and to the highest standards of quality, scalability, security, and reliability.
Identify opportunities for process improvement, removing roadblocks and driving innovation in how we productionise AI and ML models.
Support career growth for your team, creating pathways for learning and development, and providing regular feedback.
Collaborate with Data Science, Platform, and Product teams to ensure AI and ML models are deployed, monitored, and maintained effectively.
Promote best practices in model deployment, observability, CI/CD for ML, and responsible AI principles, helping engineers embed these into their workflows.
Oversee the development and implementation of scalable AI and ML pipelines, ensuring efficient experimentation, versioning, and monitoring of models.
Partner with other engineering and product leaders to shape Trustpilot’s overall AI and ML strategy while fostering cross-functional collaboration.
Champion operational excellence in AI and ML, ensuring models are reliable, reproducible, and continuously improved.


Ideal Qualifications


Experience managing and leading ML/AI Ops, Data platform or software engineering teams.
Strong technical background as a ML, Data, Software Engineer or a Data Scientist.
Strong understanding of engineering principles and a willingness to learn and work with AI and ML operational challenges.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, able to navigate complex technical and business challenges and turn them into actionable goals.
A passion for building teams and coaching engineers to grow in their careers, whether from an AI, ML, data, or software background.


Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

At Trustpilot we want to create a strong feeling of belonging, for every Trustie, where you don’t feel like you have to ‘fit in’, you can just be you, your really awesome self. A place where you’re treated fairly, your perspective is valued, and you’re empowered to do the best work of your life. Trustpilot is committed to this vision. We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. Join us in breaking barriers and reshaping the tech industry!


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.
Show more
HTML:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way—but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

Engineering Manager

Calling All Transformative Engineering Managers!

Are you a natural leader with a passion for empowering teams and driving operational excellence in AI and machine learning? Whether you come from a ML/AI engineering, data engineering or software engineering background, Trustpilot is looking for a driven Engineering Manager to lead our AI Platform team!

The Mission Awaits

As an Engineering Manager at Trustpilot, you’ll lead a team focused on building and maintaining the infrastructure, tools, and processes that enable scalable, reliable, and efficient AI and ML operations. Your leadership will be key in defining and evolving best practices for deploying, monitoring, and managing AI and ML models in production. Your technical expertise and leadership will shape the future of AI and ML operations at Trustpilot.

Your Role As An Engineering Manager

  • Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of engineers, fostering a collaborative and high-performance environment.
  • Drive the team’s technical vision, ensuring alignment with business goals and best practices in AI and ML operations.
  • Own the delivery process, ensuring initiatives are implemented on time and to the highest standards of quality, scalability, security, and reliability.
  • Identify opportunities for process improvement, removing roadblocks and driving innovation in how we productionise AI and ML models.
  • Support career growth for your team, creating pathways for learning and development, and providing regular feedback.
  • Collaborate with Data Science, Platform, and Product teams to ensure AI and ML models are deployed, monitored, and maintained effectively.
  • Promote best practices in model deployment, observability, CI/CD for ML, and responsible AI principles, helping engineers embed these into their workflows.
  • Oversee the development and implementation of scalable AI and ML pipelines, ensuring efficient experimentation, versioning, and monitoring of models.
  • Partner with other engineering and product leaders to shape Trustpilot’s overall AI and ML strategy while fostering cross-functional collaboration.
  • Champion operational excellence in AI and ML, ensuring models are reliable, reproducible, and continuously improved.

Ideal Qualifications

  • Experience managing and leading ML/AI Ops, Data platform or software engineering teams.
  • Strong technical background as a ML, Data, Software Engineer or a Data Scientist.
  • Strong understanding of engineering principles and a willingness to learn and work with AI and ML operational challenges.
  • Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, able to navigate complex technical and business challenges and turn them into actionable goals.
  • A passion for building teams and coaching engineers to grow in their careers, whether from an AI, ML, data, or software background.

Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

At Trustpilot we want to create a strong feeling of belonging, for every Trustie, where you don’t feel like you have to ‘fit in’, you can just be you, your really awesome self. A place where you’re treated fairly, your perspective is valued, and you’re empowered to do the best work of your life. Trustpilot is committed to this vision. We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. Join us in breaking barriers and reshaping the tech industry!

  • A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
  • Competitive compensation package + bonus
  • 25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
  • Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
  • Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
  • Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
  • Paid parental leave
  • Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
  • Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
  • Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
  • Employee discounts to restaurants and shops

We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Title: Machine Learning Platform Engineer
Description:
Are you passionate about Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence and excited to work at the intersection of Cloud Infrastructure and cutting-edge ML/AI solutions in a fast paced business? This is your chance to embed with our Fundamental Modelling (FM) team, developing large-scale ML/AI models using and supplying terabytes of meteorological data to drive insights and competitive advantage in energy trading.




About the Role

We’re seeking a hands-on ML Platform Engineer to work directly with the Head of Fundamental Modelling as a strategic business partner, while reporting to the Manager of Cloud Development ensuring an anchor in the wider technical organization.

Your mission: Enable our FM and Quant Trading teams to focus entirely on sophisticated modelling and meteorology solutions by ensuring platform infrastructure and operations run seamlessly in the background.

You’ll help maintain and expand our hybrid infrastructure using Azure Cloud and on-premise high-performance computing (HPC) resources, ensuring the right balance of performance, agility, reliability and cost for each use case.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and manage the ML platform for large-scale data and complex ML models.
Implement MLOps best practices to streamline development and deployment.
Optimize the platform’s performance and efficiency across Azure Cloud and on-premise HPC.
Ensure smooth transition of ML and Big Data applications from development to production.
Proactively solve infrastructure issues and improve platform reliability.
Partner with data scientists and engineers to enable successful deployment and monitoring.
Drive platform improvements to meet business and technical needs.




We expect that you are familiar with several of the topics below and are ready to embrace learning the rest in your job with us!

Experience building and maintaining ML platforms in data-intensive environments.
Strong experience with Azure Cloud, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Expertise in GPU-based ML training and high-memory computing.
Experience with HPC infrastructure and cloud integration.
Ability to assess and recommend the best infrastructure solutions.
Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
Experience with time-series or geospatial data is a plus.




Personal Competencies

Collaborative: You work well with data scientists and engineers to solve challenges together.
Business-driven: You seek to understand business needs and deliver effective solutions.
Proactive: You anticipate problems and address them before they escalate.
Customer-focused: You ensure the FM team can rely on the platform without friction.
Adaptable: You adjust strategies based on changing business and technical requirements.
Clear communicator: You explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Did we pique your interest?

Click the "APPLY" button - we are continuously looking for talented people to join our team.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning/AI konsulenter
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du konsulent med erfaring i Machine Learning/AI, og er du bosiddende i Danmark, med minimum 5 års professionel erfaring fra IT relaterede projekter ude hos kunder, og har du ikke før haft kontakt med os, så kunne et partnerskab med emagine måske være interessant for dig?

emagine er et high-end konsulenthus med hovedkvarter i København, der leverer skræddersyede ydelser og ekspertise ved brug af et netværk af ekspertkonsulenter.

Som freelance konsulent kan du blive inddraget i opgaver, enten som ekspertrådgiver, som en del af et emagine team, eller som en betroet konsulent ude på opgave i en af vores kunders organisation.

I Danmark har vi kontorer i København, Aarhus og Aalborg, med over 900 konsulenter ude på opgaver lige nu. I Europa har vi over 5.000 konsulenter på opgave.

Tilmeld dig vores database og få muligheden for at arbejde med nogle af de mest innovative virksomheder i branchen.

At blive medlem af vores konsulentdatabase har mange fordele, herunder:


Adgang til en bred vifte af projekter med internationale virksomheder, så du kan anvende dine færdigheder og ekspertise til projekter, der betyder noget.
Opgaver, der matcher dine færdigheder og ekspertise, hvilket sikrer, at du arbejder på projekter, der stemmer overens med dine styrker.
Kurser og kompetenceudvikling på alle niveauer med særlig erfaring inden for undervisning i projekt- program- og porteføljeledelse.
Muligheder for at udvide din portefølje af projekter og fremme din karriere


Som konsulent med Machine Learning/AI kompetencer, bør du have erfaring med en del af følgende:


Artifical Intelligence (AI)
Machine Learning (ML)
Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
Python
Deep Learning
SQL
Neurale Netværk
Large Language Model (LLM)
Microsoft Azure AI Studio
AutoGen
Docker
R
Algoritmer
NLP Engineering
Kubernetes
Show more
