Title: Senior Backend Developer (Python) - Remote
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Game Analytics

GameAnalytics is a leading analytics tool for anyone building a mobile game. Our platform helps everyone in the industry, from indie developers, to growing games studios, to global publishers. Our network includes more than 100k games, which are played by north of 2 billion people each month. That's more than ⅓ of the world's mobile gamers. What's our mission? To help game developers make the right decisions based on data. And by joining our team, you'll be working on new and innovative products to help tens of thousands of people in the industry do just that.

About The Team

You will join our backend API development team as a remote member outside of Denmark, where our head office is based. Together you'll be working on some of our most critical APIs handling authentication, authorisation and the business logic for all our users, studios & games, providing the backbone that powers our web application. We work using a modern development stack (Python 3, MySQL, Terraform, ECS/Fargate), use cloud technologies (AWS, GCP) and we value simplicity, code quality, automation; with the aim of iterating fast and delivering value. We have major new product offerings in development and the team will be involved in all areas of planning, designing and development.

What we are looking for


As an experienced developer you will be a key contributor involved in planning, designing and developing current and new product offerings
Making sure we build the right thing at the right time. We value the ability to make reasonable and informed decisions with minimal supervision
Be able to take ownership (together with the other team members) of several APIs (currently based on Python), our main user management database or any future production critical systems
Managing AWS resources and deployment procedures in collaboration with our other engineering teams
Keeping code quality high using code reviews (pull requests) and documented coding standards
Ability to collaborate and communicate well with other teams, including product and support
Understanding of business processes and data governance implications, when working with customer accounts
Train, coach and support hiring of team members



Requirements


Essential:


Excellent understanding of Python OR an excellent understanding of another backend related language (Java, Erlang, Elixir, Golang, Ruby...) AND some Python experience
Excellent understanding of API development; including best practices, industry standards, performance implications..
3+ years of experience building and managing production systems
Experience with SQL and RDBMS concepts, using these on large projects, preferably using MySQL or PostgreSQL
Ability to write high quality and maintainable code, only embracing complexity when truly needed. Approach coding so that others can read and work with your code
Experience with modern development life cycle, including automated testing and deployment
Excellent communication and team collaboration skills
Experience with developing software in a cloud environment, preferably in AWS



Desirable:


A degree in computer science or equivalent
Good knowledge of FastAPI, Flask or other Python API frameworks
Knowledge of SQLAlchemy or other ORM frameworks
Experience with infrastructure-as-code systems (Terraform, Ansible, etc.)
Experience with containerized applications (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS/Fargate or similar)
Comfortable working in a Linux environment
Experience with, or interest in, other programming languages besides Python
Experience with authentication/authorization protocols, such as OAuth2
An interest in project management and software development methodologies
Passion in videogames and the industry



Benefits


Working flexibility
(When in office) Food, snacks and drinks
25 Days paid holiday (excluding bank holiday)
Year-end office closure (paid holiday downtime between Christmas and New Year's)
Company sickness leave
Carers' leave
Additional compassionate leave
"Work-from-Anywhere" Scheme (15 days per year)
Learning budgets
Monthly social nights
Expense phone bill
Show more

Title: Graduate Program - Innovation Impact -R&D Data Scientist Chemistry (d/f/m)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About the Innovation Impact Program Our 18-month Graduate Program starts on October 1st, 2025, at our Henkel Adhesive Technologies Innovation Center in Düsseldorf. You will be part of an exciting development journey, where you will receive a permanent contract from day one, relocation support, and hands-on experience across various innovative technologies. Upon completion, you will have the opportunity to transition into global roles within Henkel’s innovation network.

What You´ll Do


Partner with product developers and application engineers as part of our R&D team in Düsseldorf, Germany to understand technologies, data collection processes, and challenges driving the digital transformation within R&D
Design and conduct data analysis projects to identify trends and patterns in formulation data sets, and build and deploy machine learning models to predict formulation performance, stability, and quality
Collaborate closely with R&D colleagues to translate data insights into new formulations, product development decisions, and application processes - optimizing R&D workflows
Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards to effectively communicate insights to technical and business stakeholders
Leverage your digital skillset to drive awareness and application of data-based decision-making and digital tools across R&D
Support the digital transformation of R&D by implementing data-driven workflows for process development and knowledge management


What makes you a good fit


You have recently completed, or are about to complete, a Master’s or Ph.D. that combines a strong foundation in Chemistry, Engineering, or Materials Science with Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, or a related analytical field—for example, a Bachelor’s in a natural science and a digitally focused Master's, or interdisciplinary studies that enable you to understand both lab-based R&D and data-driven approaches
You bring first hands-on experience with data analysis and modeling in scientific or engineering contexts, and have a strong grasp of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, classification)
You are proficient in data tools such as Python or R, DoE software like Minitab or JMP, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau); experience with IoT, finite element analysis (FEA), and computational fluid dynamics (CFD) is a plus
You are interested in working in a laboratory environment, motivated to learn about formulations, product development, and R&D workflows, and keen to apply your skills in a hands-on setting
You enjoy collaborating with non-digital colleagues, and can confidently explain digital tools and data concepts in a simple, practical way to support their daily work
You are interested in growing your career in Henkel’s global Innovation network, with relocation as one possible path after the program.
Proficiency in English is essential, as you will work in an international environment


Ready to take the next step in your career? Visit our program landing page for full details and apply today.

Some perks of joining Henkel

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, generations and disabilities. If there are any specific accommodations or adjustments you require for the interview process or your on-site appointment, please inform us, and we'll do our best to accommodate your requests.
Show more
HTML:
About the Innovation Impact Program Our 18-month Graduate Program starts on October 1st, 2025, at our Henkel Adhesive Technologies Innovation Center in Düsseldorf. You will be part of an exciting development journey, where you will receive a permanent contract from day one, relocation support, and hands-on experience across various innovative technologies. Upon completion, you will have the opportunity to transition into global roles within Henkel’s innovation network.

What You´ll Do

  • Partner with product developers and application engineers as part of our R&D team in Düsseldorf, Germany to understand technologies, data collection processes, and challenges driving the digital transformation within R&D
  • Design and conduct data analysis projects to identify trends and patterns in formulation data sets, and build and deploy machine learning models to predict formulation performance, stability, and quality
  • Collaborate closely with R&D colleagues to translate data insights into new formulations, product development decisions, and application processes - optimizing R&D workflows
  • Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards to effectively communicate insights to technical and business stakeholders
  • Leverage your digital skillset to drive awareness and application of data-based decision-making and digital tools across R&D
  • Support the digital transformation of R&D by implementing data-driven workflows for process development and knowledge management

What makes you a good fit

  • You have recently completed, or are about to complete, a Master’s or Ph.D. that combines a strong foundation in Chemistry, Engineering, or Materials Science with Data Science, Physics, Computer Science, or a related analytical field—for example, a Bachelor’s in a natural science and a digitally focused Master's, or interdisciplinary studies that enable you to understand both lab-based R&D and data-driven approaches
  • You bring first hands-on experience with data analysis and modeling in scientific or engineering contexts, and have a strong grasp of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms (e.g., regression, classification)
  • You are proficient in data tools such as Python or R, DoE software like Minitab or JMP, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau); experience with IoT, finite element analysis (FEA), and computational fluid dynamics (CFD) is a plus
  • You are interested in working in a laboratory environment, motivated to learn about formulations, product development, and R&D workflows, and keen to apply your skills in a hands-on setting
  • You enjoy collaborating with non-digital colleagues, and can confidently explain digital tools and data concepts in a simple, practical way to support their daily work
  • You are interested in growing your career in Henkel’s global Innovation network, with relocation as one possible path after the program.
  • Proficiency in English is essential, as you will work in an international environment

Ready to take the next step in your career? Visit our program landing page for full details and apply today.

Some perks of joining Henkel

At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, generations and disabilities. If there are any specific accommodations or adjustments you require for the interview process or your on-site appointment, please inform us, and we'll do our best to accommodate your requests.

Title: Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, designing robust and scalable software infrastructure, and collaborating with dedicated colleagues — all while playing a key role in scaling our business even further.




Does this sound exciting? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer at Alipes Capital.




At Alipes Capital, we have been a market leader in automating financial markets since our inception in 2008, pioneering fully automated natural language processing systems to read and interpret financial news.




To accomplish our goal of being the best at what we do, we are focused on building a world-class ML engineering workflow, ensuring seamless training, deployment and monitoring of our predictive models. Your work will be instrumental in further developing the infrastructure that transforms massive unstructured financial data sets into production-ready inference models that drive real-time trading decisions.




In doing so, you will get a chance to help develop scalable, high-performance ML systems, ensuring a seamless pipeline from dataset generation through model prototyping to production deployment.




Key responsibilities include:

Designing and optimizing infrastructure to support distributed model training and experiment tracking
Building and automating robust data pipelines for dataset generation and feature engineering, while enabling data version control
Developing software for rapid experimentation and deployment, including automated testing, continuous integration, and delivery
Implementing best practices in software development, ensuring maintainability, scalability, and efficiency of ML systems through automated testing and real-time monitoring,
Improving model deployment workflows, focusing on minimizing latency, ensuring reproducibility, and enabling fast iterations




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.




About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with passionate quantitative researchers covering 8 nationalities – fourteen PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and are willing to engage on a deep, technical level of understanding.




About you

Fluency with computer science fundamentals – data structures and algorithms
Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets and training distributed models
Experience with Python, in particular the data preprocessing, ETL pipelines and distributed systems
Familiarity with strongly typed languages like C# or C/C++ or Rust
A few years of experience in production-grade environments working with the full Machine Learning stack from dataset generation through model training and real-life validation and monitoring
Experience with distributed computing frameworks (for example Spark, Ray or Dask)
Familiarity with containerization technologies (for example Docker Compose or Kubernetes)




Nice to have

A scientific and inquisitive mind
Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
Familiarity with algorithmic trading concepts
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics or physics




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in Nordhavn with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.




If you have specific questions about the role, you are welcome to email us at quant_jobs@alipescapital.com. Please do not send in your applications to this email address, as our interview team will not have visibility to review.

Show more

Title: Python Backend Developer for Seculyze
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join Our Cybersecurity Revolution!

At Seculyze, we’re not just responding to cybersecurity threats—we’re anticipating them. We are designing and building a SaaS platform as an answer to that, where we need you as part of our dynamic team. You’ll help engineer cutting-edge solutions that empower companies to make quick, informed decisions in the face of cyber attacks. Our mission is to optimize the efforts of cybersecurity professionals, making them more efficient and effective. If you’re ready to shape the future of cybersecurity, we want you on our team.




About the Role

You’ll be instrumental in building the backend of our Seculyze platform, using Python to develop robust, scalable services. This role involves:

Collaborating with top-notch cybersecurity and technical professionals to design and innovate backend solutions.
Writing clean, efficient, and secure Python code.
Integrating with Azure technologies and deploying solutions in a cloud environment.
Potentially conducting DevOps for seamless integration and easy customer onboarding




Who We Are

Seculyze is a startup focused on redefining cybersecurity through innovative software solutions. Our platform is in its formative stages, and your expertise in backend development will be crucial to our growth.




Why Seculyze?

Impactful Work: Your contributions directly prevent and mitigate cyber threats.
Collaborative Environment: Work alongside experts in business, IT, and cybersecurity in a supportive, team-oriented culture.
Professional Growth: Develop your skills through professional sparring, selected certifications, and engagement with a highly experienced management team.




Your Expertise

Proficient in Python, with experience in frameworks like FastAPI.
Skilled in REST API development, data modeling, and microservices.
Experience with Azure DevOps, Docker, Kubernetes, and cloud-based storage solutions (e.g., PostgreSQL, CosmosDB).
Familiarity with the agile frameworks and Azure DevOps practices is a plus.




Benefits & Culture

Flexible working conditions with a base in Copenhagen - remote work options available. We roughly work 60% from home or at the client and 40% at the office. 
Competitive salary reflective of your skills and experience.
A flat organizational structure where your ideas and innovations can influence the company’s direction.
The right person might also be able to transition into a lead role.




Interested?

To apply here on LinkedIn. If you have any questions or need further information, feel free to reach out to Alex Steninge Jacobsen at alex@seculyze.com.




Join us at Seculyze, where you can be a part of a team dedicated to making a real difference in the cybersecurity landscape.

Show more

Title: We’re Hiring Testers for My Bike Guard!
Description:
We’re Hiring Testers for My Bike Guard!




At My Bike Guard, we're on a mission to revolutionize cycling safety, and we need curious, passionate individuals who want to be a part of shaping the future of cycling tech.




We're looking for testers to try out the pre-launch version of our app and help us make it even better. Your feedback will play a crucial role in fine-tuning the features that will keep cyclists safer on the road!




If you're excited about:

Cycling safety
Innovative tech
Making a difference

Then we want to hear from you!




What we need:

Cyclists who are ready to test out the latest version of our app.
Curious minds willing to share insights, feedback, and suggestions.
People who care about the cycling community and want to help create a smarter, safer riding experience.




What you’ll get:

Early access to My Bike Guard.
A chance to influence the future of cycling safety.
Recognition for helping us build something meaningful.



Interested? Drop us a message or apply now, and let’s make cycling safer, together!




Apply => http://mybikeguard.com/signup




#MyBikeGuard #CyclingSafety #CyclingTech #AppTesting #JoinTheJourney #CyclingCommunity #TestersWanted #InnovativeCycling #FutureOfCycling

Title: 应用数学家 - 台湾
Description:
Outlier幫助世界上最具創新性的公司通過提供人類反饋來改進他們的AI模型。您是一位經驗豐富的數學專家，願意將您的專業知識用於訓練AI模型嗎？

關於這個機會：

Outlier正在尋找有才華的數學專家來幫助訓練生成型人工智能模型。這個自由職業的機會是遠程工作的，工作時間靈活，因此您可以在最適合您的時間工作。您可以通過以下方式貢獻您的專業知識：


評估AI模型生成的專業領域文本的真實性和相關性
設計並回答與數學相關的問題
評估並對AI模型生成的專業領域回應進行排序


期望的專業知識範例：


擁有數學或相關學科的學士學位或更高學位
擁有作為數學專業人士的工作經驗
能够用流利的英语和台语清晰地书写与数学相关的概念


薪資：


目前，數學專家在核心項目工作的薪資範圍為每小時19.5至50美元。
薪資根據專業知識、技能評估、地點、項目需求及其他因素有所不同。例如，對於擁有博士學位的人，可能會提供更高的薪資。對於非核心工作，例如項目初期的入職培訓或項目加班階段，可能會適用較低的薪資。某些項目會提供獎勳支付。請查看每個項目的支付條款。

Title: Recently graduated Engineer, wanting to work within AIT Quality at Novo Nordisk Engineering
Description:
Does the idea of working in Quality IT excite you? And do you thrive on gaining knowledge of GXP and pharmaceutical production? Then you’ll fit right in!

What do we do at NNE?

We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and we design and build pharma facilities that are essential for millions of patients all over the world. Our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you are passionate about working for a noble cause on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.

About The Role

We are looking for graduates to join our team of engineers in Automation IT Project Quality Management. As a team, we are working on the biggest projects in Novo Nordisk.

Why do we need you? Our goal is to implement robust and excellent solutions for our owner. Your role will be key in learning about development, doing testing and verification of master batch records and supporting our Quality Engineers.

Location Kalundborg Department Automation IT Project Quality Management

Experience Graduate level Employment Type Full Time

How You Might Spend Your Days

As a Graduate, you’ll be:


Getting on-the-job training and guidance to be confident and prepared to support some of our clients’ most complex manufacturing execution issues
Contributing in gathering technical requirements through a variety of techniques (e.g., facilitated workshops, work sessions and interviews, technical analysis)
Learning from senior colleagues with an innovative mindset to ensure that workflows / recipes are successfully and compliantly designed, developed, deployed in line with site business processes and technical standards
Commissioning and undertaking test and qualification of IT systems in manufacturing environments
Estimating and coordinating own tasks
Depending on your profile it would be Quality or IT system Validation. We will have a talk about where we see your potential.



Who You Are

We care about who you are as a person. In the end, how you work, and your energy, is what impacts the results we achieve as a team. As a person, you are:


A team-oriented person, curious and eager to learn
Comfortable with customer relations
Proficient in spoken and written Danish and English
Passionate about your work and with a personal drive
Pro-active, cooperative and with a motivated mindset.



The miles you’ve walked

In all positions, there are some things that are preferred, and others, a bonus. If you do not meet all the qualifications listed below, you are welcome to offer alternative experience that you think would be valuable in this role.


An engineering, computer scientist or similar degree or a having pharmaceutical production experience.
Experience with IT on various levels



Why choose NNE?

We provide a range of perks and benefits tailored to enhance your overall experience. Some highlights include:


Vibrant and project-based work environment
Collaboration and innovation-based culture
True empowerment and flexible working conditions
Inclusive environment that values diversity and equity



Unleash your potential

NNE is short for Novo Nordisk Engineering. And for all of us who work here, NNE means so much more. We are the epitome of a people business and, as such, we are dedicated to continuously developing our people. We do not expect you to know it all, and we recognize that a great onboarding experience is key. We therefore greet new colleagues with our award-nominated onboarding program, and in-house talent programs designed to keep our biggest asset – you - developed for the long-run.

Did we spark your curiosity? If you’re ready to join our passion, let’s hear from you.

Deadline of application is 10 June, 2025.

Questions before applying? Please contact Manager Ima Mir on +45 30 75 55 86.

At NNE, we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. To maintain fairness, we request that you refrain from including a photo in your CV.

Please note we only accept applications submitted through our online recruitment system.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

We will invite to interviews on a running basis.

To learn more about us visit www.nne.com
Show more

NNE is short for Novo Nordisk Engineering. And for all of us who work here, NNE means so much more. We are the epitome of a people business and, as such, we are dedicated to continuously developing our people. We do not expect you to know it all, and we recognize that a great onboarding experience is key. We therefore greet new colleagues with our award-nominated onboarding program, and in-house talent programs designed to keep our biggest asset – you - developed for the long-run.

Did we spark your curiosity? If you’re ready to join our passion, let’s hear from you.

 Deadline of application is 10 June, 2025.

Questions before applying? Please contact Manager Ima Mir on +45 30 75 55 86.

At NNE, we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. To maintain fairness, we request that you refrain from including a photo in your CV.

Please note we only accept applications submitted through our online recruitment system.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

We will invite to interviews on a running basis.

To learn more about us visit www.nne.com

Title: IT Platform Engineer for MLOps (Machine Learning) Area
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

In Data Science Platform Squad, we Build and maintain a generic, scalable and govern platform for Data Science model of online models to enable an automated, compliant and efficient Model Life Cycle process. We use technologies like Open-Shift to build Containerized platform for Hosting Model execution & Deployment.

Our squad is responsible for hosting Python statistical and machine learning models, primarily serving the Data Science communities who develop these models on behalf of various enterprise domains within the bank. We manage AAPF (Advanced Analytical Platform for Fraud), which works alongside CMDEP (Containerized Management Deployment and Execution platform) to execute machine learning models for scoring payment transactions for fraud, including e-banking domestic/international and District International models deployed in CMDEP. Additionally, we are tasked with transforming the current On-Prem infrastructure into a Cloud-Native platform.

As a MLOps IT Platform Engineer, you will work closely with the Product Owner and Chapter Lead in a “2 in a box” model, using agile methodologies. You will be responsible to develop and maintain scalable ML pipelines on futured MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You will be tasked with ensuring seamless and automated transition of models from development to production using CICD workflows, implement the infrastructure as code. You will ensure that our machine learning models operate reliably, efficiently and at scale.

You will:


Implement automated pipelines for model training, validation and inference
Build and maintain CI/CD workflows using Github actions to ensure model code is versioned and seamlessly deployed to production
Utilize tools like MLflow for model tracking, versioning and deployment
Use terraform to provision and manage scalable secure infrastructure required for ML workloads
Leverage docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML models


About you:


Minimum of 2 years of practical experience in MLOps platform to build model development deployment, execution and maintenance of ML pipelines
In-depth knowledge of AWS services and Databricks
Proficiency in Python, Pyspark
Experience in CI/CD tools Terraform and container orchestration
Problem-solving and debugging skills
Understanding and practical experience with PubSub and Kafka streaming services would be beneficial
Upper-Intermediate English skills


“We believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.”

We offer:

If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 EUR to 4920 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be IT Platform Engineer.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Dinesh Chaudhari via LinkedIn or email dinc@danskebank.dk , and I will answer your questions!

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Application Engineer
Description:
Application Engineer søges til Nordcad




Er du vores nye kollega?




Vi søger en Application Engineer, som skal fungere som vores kunders foretrukne sparringspartner. Du skal derfor trives med både kundekontakt, og teknisk og kompleks udvikling af elektronik systemer. Er du utålmodig og måldrevet af natur? Er du nysgerrig, og har du altid haft teknisk flair? Kan du lide at præsentere og rådgive?




Så skal du læse videre!

Timer: Fuldtid

Tiltrædelse: August (vi starter screeninger allerede nu, og afholder løbende samtaler)

Arbejdssted: Aalborg







Hvis du kan genkende dette, så er det dig vi leder efter!

Du er utrolig måldrevet. Du elsker et klart mål og en klar retning, og der findes nærmest ingen bedre følelse end at nå de mål, du har sat dig. Du elsker at føle dig effektiv, og at udrette noget.
Du er utålmodig af natur. Du får et stort energiboost, når du får lov til at igangsætte ting. Du er heller ikke bange for det uventede, og du har næsten altid været god til at håndtere det uforudsete.
Når du har lavet en aftale, tager du 100% ansvar for den. Du føler nærmest et psykologisk ejerskab over dine forpligtelser, da du ikke kan lide uforløste ting på dit bord.
Du drives af at få et smil frem hos andre, og du bærer det altid rundt selv. Du bruger måske humor, eller har let til smil, og du har meget nemt ved at finde de positive vinkler på ting.
Du er motiveret af uforudsigelighed og udfordringer, og så er du også ret kreativ af natur. Når andre står med problemer, så finder du forløsning og motivation ved at hjælpe dem med at fikse tingene. Du er motiveret af kompleksitet.
Du kan hurtigt forholde dig til ny viden, og hvad den betyder. Du er nysgerrig, og hurtig til at lære nyt og sætte det i brug bagefter. Du finder det generelt stimulerende at lære nyt.
Du er selvsikker i dine tanker og beslutninger, og når du formidler, lytter andre. Du er overbevisende og troværdig, da du har styr på dine ting, og ved hvad du snakker om.







Dine ansvarsområder vil være:

Hjælpe kunder godt i gang med diverse tools og systemer.
Lave analysearbejde for kunderne, og hjælpe med at skræddersy forskellige løsninger.
Udvikle nye produkter med teamet og kunderne.
Udarbejde og fremvise produktpræsentationer og tekniske demoer i Norden.
Udarbejde og afholde webinarer.
Generelt at besøge kunder og identificere tekniske behov, for at starte nye projekter op og hjælpe kunderne godt i gang.







Hvad vi forventer af dig:

Flydende dansk & engelsk. Du føler dig komfortabel med samtaler på dansk/norsk/svensk.
Du har som minimum en bacheloruddannelse indenfor elektronik. Det er en fordel at have arbejdet med simulering, og du har praktisk erfaring med elektronik design.
Du har gerne taget en længerevarende uddannelse inden for elektronik, og du skal helst have arbejdet med elektronik udvikling i nogle år. Kunderne skal kunne mærke trygheden i, at du har stået med tingene i hænderne selv, og du derfor ved hvad du snakker om.
Du har lyst til at rejse i de nordiske lande (30-50 dage om året), og du kan selv stille bil til rådighed.







Om Nordcad og teamkulturen

Nordcad er en førende leverandør af software til elektronik industrien i Norden.

Vi har eksisteret siden 1987, og har i dag også selskaber i Norge, Sverige og Finland. Vi sælger software for Cadence, som er en af verdens førende software producenter. Vi er i øjeblikket 20 medarbejdere, der arbejder på at hjælpe blandt andet elektronikindustrien med at være forrest på teknologi.




Vi er en stærk partner til vores kunder, fordi vi går meget op i at levere den nyeste knowhow, og så kan vi rigtig godt lide at rådgive vores kunder. Vi skal være deres Go-To, altid.




Vores kultur bærer præg af ’Frihed under ansvar’ – og hvad mener vi så med det?

Vi ansætter folk som vi stoler på, kan deres kram. Og det man ikke kan på forhånd, det lærer vi dem. Vi går ind for autonomi, og for at skabe en hverdag hvor man trives under det ansvar man har. Når man får energi af at løse sine opgaver, så oplever vi at medarbejderne naturligt tager mere medansvar, og at kvaliteten altid er høj.




Kulturen hos os er en god blanding af en morgenhilsen ved kaffemaskinen, og et fælles drive om at levere service fra den øverste skuffe. Vi er både sociale og hårdtarbejdende, fordi vi mener man godt kan have det sjovt, imens man leverer 100%.







Hvad vi tilbyder

Et arbejdsmiljø hvor vi forsøger at forstå dig, på en sådan måde, at vi kan spille dig bedst muligt god ift. opgaver, ledelsesstil og teamkultur
Mulighed for at blive en del af den danske afdeling i en international koncern
Sociale arrangementer hver måned







Test i rekrutteringsprocessen

I rekrutteringsprocessen bruger vi talenttest. Du vil derfor i løbet af processen modtage et link til testen.

I testen handler det ikke om at svare rigtigt eller forkert, men om at afdække hvorvidt din naturlige adfærd og styrker matcher den kontekst du skal arbejde i.

Kan du genkende dig selv i opslaget? Så ser vi frem til at høre fra dig!







Spørgsmål

Har du nogle spørgsmål, så kontakt venligst:




Rasmus Schelde-Bollin

Recruitment & Talent Specialist

TalentX

Tlf: 4073 4627

Mail: rasmus@talentx.dk

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
Sky Labs Aalborg are looking for a talented Senior Developer to join our highly skilled team. So if you are passionate about developing software for embedded products, which set the reference for broadcast and streaming media – Then you might be the developer we are looking for.




Sky Labs Aalborg is part of Sky Plc and Comcast Inc. Sky is one of Europe’s leading media and entertainment companies and part of Comcast Corporation. Across six countries our innovative products connect millions of customers to the best apps, and all the entertainment, sports, news and arts they love, including our own award-winning original content.




At the Aalborg office, we develop key software components for consumer devices used by Sky and Comcast broadcast and internet customers. We are expanding our presence in Denmark, adding additional technical areas and you will have a unique opportunity to grow as part of a new team starting here.




The UI team here in Aalborg consists of nine great developers, and together with them you will have the opportunity to influence the workflow and improve the performance for customer facing features on the Sky’s Glass TV. You will also be working with colleagues worldwide, to create the best solutions and continue the development.




What are we looking for?

Master or BSc in Software Engineering, Computer Science or similar education
Experience with project-oriented software development
Experience with C++ or extensive experience in a similar object-oriented language like C#, Kotlin or Swift.
Strong unit testing experience
Experience with Python or similar scripting languages
Preferably experience with CMake or similar project build environment
Experience with Linux is a plus
Strong continuous improvement mindset
Talented people with a passion for software architecture, designs and implementation of software systems
Proactive and adaptable attitude
Testing mindset




What will you be doing?

As part of this team, you will participate in the development of UI software for Sky’s Glass TV which is used by millions of customers every day. The team’s mission is to optimise engineering practices through continuous innovation with new tools, processes and frameworks.




Your key responsibilities will be:

Analysing and improving existing workflows
Over time contribute to customer facing UI features
Sharing knowledge and good programming habits




We offer more than just a job

At Sky Labs you can look forward to meeting high professionalism. But also, plenty of space to learn more and get lots of support from your colleagues. Learning and development means a lot to us, which is why we also hold development weeks several times a year and look for curious and open minded people for our teams.




We offer a competitive salary package taking your skills and qualifications into consideration and we offer flexible working hours and numerous employee benefits. We are international, and therefore have colleagues from all around the world, but our experience and age is also very diverse, which means we have colleagues who have been around for more than 20 years, as well as newly educated engineers.




We believe in better. Better products, better service, and better value. Which is why we are constantly reinventing, to meet the needs of our millions of customers worldwide – Do you want to join the team?

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:



Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices



Please apply if you have:



Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models



Benefits:



Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
Focus on mental health and well-being:

Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
No meeting Fridays

Paid parental leave
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Paid volunteer time

Development Dollars
Leadership development
Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings

Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups

Pension plan contributions
Private health & life insurance
Lunch provided five days per week & breakfast once a week
Professional espresso machine
Awesome office in the city centre of Copenhagen
Monthly social events, yoga, Thursday bars


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).


Show more
HTML:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:


  • Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
  • Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
  • Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
  • Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
  • Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices


Please apply if you have:


  • Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
  • Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
  • Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
  • Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
  • Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
  • Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
  • Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
  • Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
  • Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models


Benefits:


  • Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
  • Focus on mental health and well-being:
    • Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
    • Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
    • Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
    • No meeting Fridays
  • Paid parental leave
  • Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
  • Paid volunteer time
  • Focus on your career growth:
    • Development Dollars
    • Leadership development
    • Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings
  • Travel Discounts
  • Employee Resource Groups
  • 6 weeks paid vacation
  • Pension plan contributions
  • Private health & life insurance
  • Lunch provided five days per week & breakfast once a week
  • Professional espresso machine
  • Awesome office in the city centre of Copenhagen
  • Monthly social events, yoga, Thursday bars

Title: DATA SCIENTIST TIL AI-DREVET GRØN OMSTILLING
Description:
Vil du være med til at skabe fremtidens AI-løsninger og omsætte banebrydende innovation til værdi for dansk landbrug?




Hos SEGES Innovation søger vi en ambitiøs Data Scientist, som brænder for dataanalyse, AI-udvikling og for at gøre en reel forskel gennem Applied AI.




Et it-job med mening

SEGES Digital er SEGES Innovations digitale forretningsenhed. Vi er en førende organisation inden for udvikling af digitale løsninger til landbrugs- og fødevareområdet, og dedikerede til at forbedre landbrugs- og fødevaresektoren gennem innovative Digital og AI løsninger baseret på vores DataEstate.




Forretningsenheden Digital består af ca. 200 medarbejdere, der sammen med resten af SEGES Innovation er drevet af vores mission om at sikre fremtidens bæredygtige fødevarer. Det gør vi gennem forskning, innovation og digitale værktøjer, der optimerer og transformerer landbrugs- og fødevaresektoren igennem den grønne omstilling af erhvervet.




Om stillingen

I afdelingen Data & Analytics hos SEGES Innovation skaber vi værdi ved at udvikle intelligente løsninger til fremtidens landbrug. Vi overvåger dyrevelfærd i staldene ved hjælp af avanceret computer vision, holder øje med marker via satellitdata og optimerer landmandens beslutninger med præcise prognosemodeller. Vi eksperimenterer også med banebrydende generative AI-teknologier, der automatisk analyserer og håndterer store mængder tekst og dokumentation.




Som Data Scientist hos os får du mulighed for at arbejde med hele data science-livscyklussen – fra indledende analyse og feature-identifikation til avanceret modeludvikling, optimering, implementering og evaluering. Du vil få lejlighed til at arbejde med state-of-the-art teknikker inden for blandt andet computer vision, generative AI samt klassiske prædiktive modeller baseret på tabulære data. Hos os bliver du en del af et engageret team, der arbejder tæt sammen med faglige eksperter om at omsætte data til konkret værdi for landbruget.




Din rolle

Du arbejder med en varieret portefølje af projekter, hvor du anvender din ekspertise inden for dataanalyse, modellering og løsningsudvikling til at omsætte komplekse udfordringer til konkrete, værdiskabende løsninger. Du vil blive en nøgleperson i at sikre, at vores AI-drevne produkter konstant er relevante, effektive og værdiskabende for dansk landbrug.




Din rolle indebærer

Udvikling af AI-løsninger i samarbejde med faglige eksperter fra Innovationsafdelingen.
Selvstændigt ansvar for AI-projekter med fokus på dataanalyse, modeludvikling og dokumentation af resultater.
Arbejde med klassiske AI-principper, såsom supervised og unsupervised machine learning.
Håndtering af forskellige typer data, fx tidsserier, billeder, geospatiale data og tekst.
Løbende dialog, sparring og præsentation af resultater til interne interessenter.
Aktivt bidrag til kompetenceopbygning inden for AI og data science i både projekt- og produktkontekster.




Hvad vi drømmer om...

Vi ser gerne, at du har erfaring inden for data science, men lysten til at lære er vigtigere end nuværende kompetenceniveau.




Faglige kompetencer

Kendskab til datatyper som f.eks. tidsserier, geospatiale data, video/billede eller tekst.
Erfaring med Azure og/eller Databricks.
Solide kompetencer inden for Python.
Kendskab til CI/CD-principper.




Personlige kompetencer

En pragmatisk tilgang til opgaverne.
Evnen til hurtigt at tilegne dig ny viden og omsætte den til praksis.
Stærke samarbejdsevner og lyst til at være en aktiv del af et team.
En naturlig nysgerrighed og interesse for at følge med i AI-udviklingen.

Frem for alt søger vi en person med stort gåpåmod, ægte interesse for området og en stærk vilje til konstant at lære og udvikle sig.




Hvad vi tilbyder

I SEGES Innovation tilbyder vi dig en karriere med mening. Vores innovation og viden gør en stor forskel i at skabe en bæredygtig fødevareproduktion. Vores specialister arbejder med alt fra klima og miljø, planter, husdyr og digitale løsninger til vækst og vidensformidling.




Sammen bidrager vi til de løsninger, der gør landbruget og fødevareproduktionen endnu mere bæredygtig. Vi er 500 kolleger, der brænder for det, vi arbejder med. Vi omsætter for omkring 630 millioner kr. årligt.




I det digitale område af SEGES Innovation arbejder vi agilt med digitale produkt teams, der primært arbejder med SCRUM og hvis vi i al beskedenhed selv skal sige det er hamrende gode, men også kan blive bedre. Du får derfor mulighed for at sætte dit aftryk på organisationens fremtidige udvikling.




Vi tilbyder derudover en attraktiv lønpakke, fleksible arbejdsbetingelser og gode muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling.




Ansøg nu

Lyder det interessant, og kan du se dig selv i stillingen, så upload ansøgning og dit CV via "Søg jobbet".




Vil du vide mere?

Du kan læse mere om SEGES Digital her: https://segesinnovation.dk/landing-pages/et-it-job-med-mening/

Du kan se en tv-serie om, hvordan det er at arbejde i SEGES Digital, her: https://segesinnovation.dk/landing-pages/kodernes-kamp/




Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte Director, Morten Ryberg på 2812 7341 eller på mory@seges.dk







Ved rekruttering hos SEGES Innovation prioriterer vi primært din faglige ekspertise og personlighed. Vi ser mangfoldighed som en styrke, derfor opfordres alle med de rette kompetencer til at søge - uanset etnisk tilhørsforhold, religion, kønsidentitet og alder.




SEGES Innovation er en uafhængig forsknings- og innovationsvirksomhed, der arbejder for en bæredygtig og konkurrencedygtig landbrugs- og fødevareproduktion. Vi kobler faglige indsigter med digitale teknologier, så ny viden kommer ud at virke i stalden, på marken og i hele værdikæden fra jord til bord.




Vores mange forskellige eksperter udgør et unikt fagmiljø i international topklasse med ca. 500 dedikerede kolleger, der arbejder ud fra værdierne Mod, Hjerte og Dybde og i tæt samspil med Danmarks mere end 30.000 landbrug, universiteter og uddannelsesinstitutioner, landbrugsrådgivere, fødevareproducenter, energiselskaber og myndigheder.

Title: AI:Xpertise Lab
Description:
Advanced AI technologies increasingly encroach on domains traditionally occupied by expert professions – doctors, architects, and lawyers. While politicians, think tanks, and researchers highlight the potential for job savings, considerable research shows challenges in using AI in expert work. Through a novel approach integrating AI development and organizational science, AI:Xpertise lab researches the technical and organizational conditions for successfully embedding AI systems in expert work.

The lab is looking for candidates for the following four stipends:

Stipend 1: PhD in AI for healthcare

This stipend revolves around building and deploying AI in health care. The main case will be automation of anesthetic pre-screenings. Potential auxiliary cases include evaluation of laparoscopic surgery and AI assistance for spinal surgery. Candidates for this stipend should have a background in software engineering or similar and have substantial experience with machine learning. All cases involve various degrees of image analysis, so computer vision experience is a requirement. Experience with large language models is a plus. Furthermore, as AI:Xpertise is about deploying AI in the real world, we are looking for people with full-stack experience: You should not only be able to create and evaluate models, you must also be able to build a user interface and deploy your systems. You must also be interested in collaborating with organizational researchers given the interdisciplinary character of AI:Xpertise.

Stipend 2: PhD in AI for architecture

This stipend revolves around building and deploying AI in architecture. The main case will be generative AI for architecture visualization, and possibly computer vision for understanding buildings. Candidates for this stipend should have a background in software engineering or similar and have substantial experience with machine learning. Experience with generative AI for image is a large advantage, and computer vision experience is a plus. Furthermore, as AI:Xpertise is about deploying AI in the real world, we are looking for people with full-stack experience: You should not only be able to create and evaluate models, you must also be able to build a user interface and deploy your systems. You must also be interested in collaborating with organizational researchers given the interdisciplinary character of AI:Xpertise.

Stipend 3: PhD in organization studies focusing on generative AI in healthcare

Large language models (LLMs) and other generative AI technologies are beginning to play a growing role in healthcare, where they are used to support clinical decision-making and patient care. While these tools promise to augment medical expertise, their integration into clinical practice poses fundamental challenges that relate to differences between expert knowledge and algorithmic reasoning. Hence, AI technologies raise important questions about how professional expertise is developed, mobilized, and recognized, in high-risk domains like medicine. As part of the AI:Xpertise lab, this PhD stipend will explore how AI tools are integrated into clinical workflows, and investigate how healthcare professionals engage with these tools, how they navigate the uncertainties and constraints of algorithmic recommendations, and how organizational routines and professional expertise co-evolve alongside new technologies. We are ideally looking for a candidate with a background in organization studies, information systems, public administration, sociology, anthropology, science and technology studies, political science, management or other related social science or humanities disciplines.

Stipend 4: PhD in organization studies focusing on generative AI in professional services

Generative AI tools are, for example, increasingly used in professional services like architecture and consulting. In fact, tasks such as image production and text generation in professional services are considered to hold great promises for being augmented. Hence, professional expertise is changing within this context, and it raises critical questions about how expertise is developed, mobilized, and recognized in such professional services. As part of the AI:Xpertise lab, this stipend will investigate how generative AI systems can be developed and embedded into professional expert services. Thus, like stipend 3, the project combines organizational research with AI development, using a comparative approach to explore both technical and organizational aspects of AI in practice. We are ideally looking for a candidate with a background in organization studies, information systems, public administration, sociology, anthropology, science and technology studies, political science, management or other related social science or humanities disciplines.

Please clearly indicate at the top of your application which of the stipendts you are applying for. The application must include a brief description (maximum 1 page) of your motivation for the stipend(s), as well as a proposed research plan (maximum 2 pages).

We expect to conduct interviews for stipend 1 and 2 in week 21 and stipend 3 and 4 in week 22.

PhD stipends are allocated to individuals who hold a Master's degree. PhD stipends are normally for a period of 3 years. It is a prerequisite for allocation of the stipend that the candidate will be enrolled as a PhD student at the relevant Doctoral School in accordance with the regulations of Ministerial Order No. 1039 of August 27, 2013 on the PhD Programme at the Universities and Certain Higher Artistic Educational Institutions. According to the Ministerial Order, the progress of the PhD student shall be assessed at regular points in time.

As for the stipends 3 and 4, there is also an option to allocate integrated PhD stipends to individuals who have not yet completed a Master’s degree and wish to begin the PhD study in connection with the Master study. Hence, a prerequisite for this type of stipend is that the candidate is enrolled in a relevant Master’s programme at AAU. Stipends of this type consist of two parts: A and B. During part A candidates are enrolled simultaneously in the Master’s programme and in the PhD programme. The stipend consists of two SU-PhD grants per month (SU= The Danish students’ Grants and Loans Scheme). One SU-PhD grant equals DKK 7,086 (2025 level). SU-PhD grants are paid for a maximum of two years. When the Master’s degree has been obtained, candidates will be employed for two years as a PhD fellow according to the present collective agreement. Part B has a maximum duration of two years. Start date of this option is 1 September 2025.

Further information

For further information about stipends as well as practical issues concerning the application procedure, please contact, for stipend 1 and 2, Associate Professor Andreas Møgelmose, Department of Architecture, Design and Media Technology, phone: +45 5090 9137, email: anmo@create.aau.dk and for stipend 3 and 4 Associate Professor Kasper Trolle Elmholt, Department of Politics and Society, phone: +45 2077 1709, email: elm@dps.aau.dk

Application

The Application Must Contain The Following


Letter of motivation that includes:
your motivation for pursuing a PhD
what you hope to learn during the PhD programme
your experience and interest in conducting research
your experience and interest in studying AI and work
Project proposal (max. 5 pages).
Describe how you plan to go about the project
Curriculum vitae
Diplomas confirming academic degrees (Master degree), including academic transcripts
Co-author statement for all enclosed co-authored publications, specifying the extent of the applicant’s contribution to the total work and signed by the co-authors

For more information on the Technical Doctoral School of IT and Design: https://www.phd.aau.dk/tech (stipend 1 and 2).

For more information on the Doctoral School of Social Sciences and Humanities: https://www.phd.aau.dk/ssh(stipend 3 and 4). Please observe the specific grade and language requirements for this Doctoral School here: https://www.phd.aau.dk/ssh/become-a-phd-student#admission-requirements

The application is only to be submitted online by using the "Apply online" button below.

Assessment

The assessment of candidates for the position will be carried out by qualified experts.

Shortlisting will be applied. This means that after the application deadline, the head of the department, with the assistance of the hiring committee, will select the applicants to be assessed. All applicants will be informed whether they have been shortlisted for assessment or not.

When the hiring process is completed, a final rejection will be sent to the applicants who are not considered for the position.

AAU wishes to reflect the diversity of society and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates regardless of personal background or belief.

The hiring process at Aalborg University may include a risk assessment as a tool to identify potential risks associated with new hires, ensuring the safety, compliance, and integrity of the workplace.

Wages and employment

Appointment and salary as a PhD fellow are according to the Ministry of Finance Circular of 15 December 2021 on the Collective Agreement for Academics in Denmark, Appendix 5, regarding PhD fellows, and with the current Circular of 11 December 2019 on the employment structure at Danish universities. Allocation of SU-PhD grants are according to the Ministerial Order on the State Educational Grant and Loan Scheme part 12, section II. This applies to integrated PhD stipends only.

Appointment and salary as a PhD fellow are according to the Ministry of Finance Circular of 15 December 2021 on the Collective Agreement for Academics in Denmark, Appendix 5, regarding PhD fellows, and with the current Circular of 11 December 2019 on the employment structure at Danish universities. Allocation of SU-PhD grants are according to the Ministerial Order on the State Educational Grant and Loan Scheme part 12, section II. This applies to integrated PhD stipends only.

Ref number

50-25046

Deadline

28.04.2025

Experience with generative AI for image is a large advantage, and computer vision experience is a plus. Furthermore, as AI:Xpertise is about deploying AI in the real world, we are looking for people with full-stack experience: You should not only be able to create and evaluate models, you must also be able to build a user interface and deploy your systems. You must also be interested in collaborating with organizational researchers given the interdisciplinary character of AI:Xpertise.

Stipend 3: PhD in organization studies focusing on generative AI in healthcare

Large language models (LLMs) and other generative AI technologies are beginning to play a growing role in healthcare, where they are used to support clinical decision-making and patient care. While these tools promise to augment medical expertise, their integration into clinical practice poses fundamental challenges that relate to differences between expert knowledge and algorithmic reasoning. Hence, AI technologies raise important questions about how professional expertise is developed, mobilized, and recognized, in high-risk domains like medicine. As part of the AI:Xpertise lab, this PhD stipend will explore how AI tools are integrated into clinical workflows, and investigate how healthcare professionals engage with these tools, how they navigate the uncertainties and constraints of algorithmic recommendations, and how organizational routines and professional expertise co-evolve alongside new technologies. We are ideally looking for a candidate with a background in organization studies, information systems, public administration, sociology, anthropology, science and technology studies, political science, management or other related social science or humanities disciplines.

Stipend 4: PhD in organization studies focusing on generative AI in professional services

Generative AI tools are, for example, increasingly used in professional services like architecture and consulting. In fact, tasks such as image production and text generation in professional services are considered to hold great promises for being augmented. Hence, professional expertise is changing within this context, and it raises critical questions about how expertise is developed, mobilized, and recognized in such professional services. As part of the AI:Xpertise lab, this stipend will investigate how generative AI systems can be developed and embedded into professional expert services. Thus, like stipend 3, the project combines organizational research with AI development, using a comparative approach to explore both technical and organizational aspects of AI in practice. We are ideally looking for a candidate with a background in organization studies, information systems, public administration, sociology, anthropology, science and technology studies, political science, management or other related social science or humanities disciplines.

Please clearly indicate at the top of your application which of the stipendts you are applying for. The application must include a brief description (maximum 1 page) of your motivation for the stipend(s), as well as a proposed research plan (maximum 2 pages).

We expect to conduct interviews for stipend 1 and 2 in week 21 and stipend 3 and 4 in week 22.

PhD stipends are allocated to individuals who hold a Master's degree. PhD stipends are normally for a period of 3 years. It is a prerequisite for allocation of the stipend that the candidate will be enrolled as a PhD student at the relevant Doctoral School in accordance with the regulations of Ministerial Order No. 1039 of August 27, 2013 on the PhD Programme at the Universities and Certain Higher Artistic Educational Institutions. According to the Ministerial Order, the progress of the PhD student shall be assessed at regular points in time.

As for the stipends 3 and 4, there is also an option to allocate integrated PhD stipends to individuals who have not yet completed a Master’s degree and wish to begin the PhD study in connection with the Master study. Hence, a prerequisite for this type of stipend is that the candidate is enrolled in a relevant Master’s programme at AAU. Stipends of this type consist of two parts: A and B. During part A candidates are enrolled simultaneously in the Master’s programme and in the PhD programme. The stipend consists of two SU-PhD grants per month (SU= The Danish students’ Grants and Loans Scheme). One SU-PhD grant equals DKK 7,086 (2025 level). SU-PhD grants are paid for a maximum of two years. When the Master’s degree has been obtained, candidates will be employed for two years as a PhD fellow according to the present collective agreement. Part B has a maximum duration of two years. Start date of this option is 1 September 2025.

Further information

For further information about stipends as well as practical issues concerning the application procedure, please contact, for stipend 1 and 2, Associate Professor Andreas Møgelmose, Department of Architecture, Design and Media Technology, phone: +45 5090 9137, email: anmo@create.aau.dk and for stipend 3 and 4 Associate Professor Kasper Trolle Elmholt, Department of Politics and Society, phone: +45 2077 1709, email: elm@dps.aau.dk

Application

The Application Must Contain The Following

  • Letter of motivation that includes:
    • your motivation for pursuing a PhD
    • what you hope to learn during the PhD programme
    • your experience and interest in conducting research
    • your experience and interest in studying AI and work
  • Project proposal (max. 5 pages).
    • Describe how you plan to go about the project
  • Curriculum vitae
  • Diplomas confirming academic degrees (Master degree), including academic transcripts
  • Co-author statement for all enclosed co-authored publications, specifying the extent of the applicant’s contribution to the total work and signed by the co-authors
For more information on the Technical Doctoral School of IT and Design: https://www.phd.aau.dk/tech (stipend 1 and 2).

For more information on the Doctoral School of Social Sciences and Humanities: https://www.phd.aau.dk/ssh(stipend 3 and 4). Please observe the specific grade and language requirements for this Doctoral School here: https://www.phd.aau.dk/ssh/become-a-phd-student#admission-requirements

The application is only to be submitted online by using the "Apply online" button below.

Assessment

The assessment of candidates for the position will be carried out by qualified experts.

Shortlisting will be applied. This means that after the application deadline, the head of the department, with the assistance of the hiring committee, will select the applicants to be assessed. All applicants will be informed whether they have been shortlisted for assessment or not.

When the hiring process is completed, a final rejection will be sent to the applicants who are not considered for the position.

AAU wishes to reflect the diversity of society and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates regardless of personal background or belief.

The hiring process at Aalborg University may include a risk assessment as a tool to identify potential risks associated with new hires, ensuring the safety, compliance, and integrity of the workplace.

Wages and employment

Appointment and salary as a PhD fellow are according to the Ministry of Finance Circular of 15 December 2021 on the Collective Agreement for Academics in Denmark, Appendix 5, regarding PhD fellows, and with the current Circular of 11 December 2019 on the employment structure at Danish universities. Allocation of SU-PhD grants are according to the Ministerial Order on the State Educational Grant and Loan Scheme part 12, section II. This applies to integrated PhD stipends only.

Appointment and salary as a PhD fellow are according to the Ministry of Finance Circular of 15 December 2021 on the Collective Agreement for Academics in Denmark, Appendix 5, regarding PhD fellows, and with the current Circular of 11 December 2019 on the employment structure at Danish universities. Allocation of SU-PhD grants are according to the Ministerial Order on the State Educational Grant and Loan Scheme part 12, section II. This applies to integrated PhD stipends only.

Title: Product Developer - Soccer (Radar/DSP - Modelling - C++/Python)
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have an interest in Soccer and Signal Processing? Do you want to develop tracking algorithms used by top athletes and in TV broadcast all around the world?  Then come and join our Soccer product team!

About The Job

We’re looking for a talented and motivated developer to join our team, working on innovative products within the soccer space. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of performance tracking and data-driven insights, with a particular focus on the development of tracking technology used by elite footballers and football teams worldwide.

Our technology integrates vision tracking with radar tracking to deliver precise ball data measurements throughout its entire flight. In this role, you'll be a key part of our Soccer Product Development, working across various domains such as signal processing, and modelling to build innovative solutions for performance analysis and optimization. From initial concept to final development, you’ll play a crucial part in enhancing our tracking solutions, applying your expertise to create real-world applications in soccer technology.

As a member of the team, you will be part of a highly-skilled team focusing on the development and optimization of our state-of-the-art tracking algorithms used to measure ball and equipment kinematics across sports. Our products combine Doppler radars and cameras, where the Radar Tracking and Signal Processing team is responsible for converting raw radar signals into accurate and meaningful data on the performance of the athlete, where after the radar data is fused with information from video feeds and other sensors. This valuable information is subsequently made accessible on the user’s mobile device for easy-to-understand feedback and analysis on performance or is used in TV broadcasting for enhancing the viewing experience or in gamification. 

Our world-leading tracking technology is utilized across many sports such as American football, golf and baseball, and you will specifically play a significant role in enhancing our soccer product solution.

Requirements

What are we looking for?

Our ideal candidate is specialized in following areas

Requirements:


Master’s degree or Ph.D. in computer science, electrical engineering, or equivalent
Knowledge of Digital Signal Processing (DSP)
Knowledge of data modeling


We are looking for a generalist with broad skills that include the requirements above. You should be passionate about applying your knowledge to solve real-world challenges and drive product development in an exciting and fast-paced industry.

Other relevant topics include:

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.


Software development and programming skills within C++ and Python
Strong mathematical skills
Optimization algorithms
Statistical signal processing
Software development experience
Strong communication skills
Machine learning
Interested in soccer


Responsibilities

Implement tracking algorithms in close collaboration with our Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team and Modelling & Analysis team.

Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks.

Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments.

We expect that you can work independently as well as contribute in a fast-paced, innovative environment together with highly skilled colleagues. 

The Office

We offer a great office environment and facilities in our brand-new purpose-built Trackman Innovation Center, located at DTU Science Park in Hørsholm. We take great pride in the building we designed and built! The office features bright meeting rooms, coffee areas to catch up with colleagues, a large testing arena with simulators available for employees and a fitness center, everything surrounded by a beautiful forest and respecting the environment. We made sure to utilize the newest technologies to be energy efficient and be mindful of ventilation and sound propagation.

The cherry on top is our canteen: with indoor and outdoor areas to enjoy the fresh food prepared by our own kitchen staff.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work. Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud to work in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race. 

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our headquarters located in Denmark (Hørsholm) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Poland, and Tokyo. We employ over 800 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where most hardware and software products are developed, tested, and manufactured.

Where innovation happens

At Trackman, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive, and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody’s voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of exceptional solutions. This mix makes Trackman an inspiring company – for our customers and colleagues.

Share our Passion! 

Apply now
